RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - RAPE PREVENTION EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION  PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY  GROUPS INVOLVED:  THE MICHIGAN COALITION TO END DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE (MCEDSV).  MCEDSV HAS BEEN A LEADER IN COMPREHENSIVE NATIONAL DOMESTIC, SEXUAL, AND DATING VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS. PRIMARY OBJECTIVE: THIS APPLICATION WAS DEVELOPED WITH THE INTENT OF UNDERSTANDING AND INCREASING CURRENT PREVENTION CAPACITY ACROSS MCEDSV, KEY STAKEHOLDERS, AND PARTNERS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY IMPLEMENTING A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT (PPCA) TO DETERMINE THE CURRENT CAPACITY TO ENHANCE AND EXPAND PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK. BASED ON THE CAPACITY ASSESSMENT FINDINGS, MCEDSV WILL DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS TO LAY THE GROUNDWORK AND FURTHER ADVANCE SV PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES THAT ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES. PRIMARY ACTIVITIES: -	COMPLETE A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT (PPCA) -	DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON PPCA -	BUILD CAPACITY WITHIN STATEWIDE PREVENTION LEADERSHIP TEAM/KEY STAKEHOLDERS AND   BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO INCORPORATE PRINCIPLES OF PRIMARY PREVENTION -	CONTINUE ACTIVISM CONSERVATORY COHORT -	CREATE UMOJA WORKGROUP -	COMPLETE CAPACITY BUILDING TRAINING TO ACTIVISM CONSERVATORY -	HOLD ACTIVISM CONSERVATORY ANNUAL PREVENTION SUMMIT -	PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAININGS, LESSONS LEARNED, AND COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE FOR RPE LEADERSHIP AND/OR REGIONAL PREVENTIONISTS -	PARTICIPATE IN E-LEARNING COLLABORATIVES ON SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND EVALUATION, FACILITATED BY A CDC-FUNDED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDER(S) -	PARTICIPATE IN SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND EVALUATION TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND RESOURCES PROVIDED IN-PERSON OR VIRTUALLY BY THE CDC-FUNDED NATIONAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE RESOURCE CENTER FOR THE PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE. REACH: THIS PROJECT IS STATEWIDE IN SCOPE AND WILL HAVE A STATEWIDE REACH AND IMPACT.

COALITION'S CAPACITY ASSESSMENT FOR PREVENTION (CCAP) - THE MARYLAND COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (MCASA) IS THE FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED STATE SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION IN MARYLAND WORKING TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO SEXUAL VIOLENCE STATEWIDE. MCASA CURRENTLY RECEIVES RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION (RPE) FUNDING THROUGH THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH TO CONDUCT EDUCATIONAL SEMINARS AND TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR PROFESSIONALS, PREPARE INFORMATIONAL MATERIALS, LEAD EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR STUDENTS AND CAMPUS PERSONNEL DESIGNED TO REDUCE THE INCIDENCE OF SEXUAL ASSAULT AT COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, AND CAPACITY-BUILDING FOR RAPE CRISIS AND RECOVERY CENTERS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS IN MARYLAND. MCASA ALSO UTILIZES RPE FUNDS TO ADVANCE OUR COMMUNITY AND SOCIETAL LEVEL PREVENTION EFFORTS THROUGH OUR CREATE PROTECTIVE ENVIRONMENTS BY IMPROVING SAFETY AND MONITORING IN MARYLAND COLLEGES AND SCHOOLS STRATEGY.  MCASA HAS BEEN WORKING TO EXPAND OUR PREVENTION PROGRAMMING FOR UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, AND INCORPORATE HEALTH EQUITY AND OTHER SOCIETY AND COMMUNITY LEVEL PREVENTION EFFORTS OVER THE LAST FEW YEARS. THIS ADDITIONAL FUNDING OPPORTUNITY, RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION, WILL PROVIDE THE OPPORTUNITY FOR MCASA TO THOROUGHLY ASSESS OUR CAPACITY TO DO THIS WORK AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR MOVING FORWARD WITH PREVENTION PROGRAMMING THAT IMPACTS HEALTH EQUITY.  MCASA WILL USE A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT TO EXAMINE OUR CURRENT SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS AND ASSESS OUR CAPACITY FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION WORK. USING THE DATA FROM THIS ASSESSMENT, MCASA WILL DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS TO ADVANCE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES THAT ALSO ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES. MCASA IS EXPECTING TO SEE SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES FROM THIS PROJECT. AS OUTLINED IN THE CDC LOGIC MODEL, SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES FOR THIS PROJECT ARE:  INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES WITHIN MCASA AND ITS CORE MEMBER PROGRAMS  INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS IN MARYLAND  INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS  INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY

WISCONSIN CAPACITY TO ADVANCE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION - THE RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION (RPE): ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION PROJECT IS ESSENTIAL TO PREVENTING SV IN WI. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, WCASA WILL ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF THE COALITION IN PREPARATION FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF SV PREVENTION STRATEGIES THAT FOCUS ON PRIMARY PREVENTION AND ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS WILL BE TO CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES, IN ORDER TO DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY, AND ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION IN FUTURE WORK. WE WILL USE A DATA-DRIVEN APPROACH TO IDENTIFY POPULATIONS AND COMMUNITIES WITH A HIGH BURDEN OF SV TO UNDERSTAND AND ADDRESS THE INEQUITIES THAT CREATE A DISPROPORTIONATE BURDEN OF SV. EFFORTS IN THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT WITH THE STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENT RPE PROGRAM, INCLUDING THE LOCAL PROJECTS CURRENTLY FUNDED FOR SV PREVENTION. PROJECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE:  - INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY FOR THE PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK AT WCASA - INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE FUNDING DEDICATED TO THE PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK IN WISCONSIN - INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES TO SUPPORT PREVENTION PLANNING & IMPLEMENTATION – INCLUDING THOSE USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATIONS OF FOCUS - INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS TO SUPPORT PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK IN WISCONSIN - INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE CURRICULA FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK - INCREASED MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT WITH DHS TO BUILD AND SUPPORT A PREVENTION INFRASTRUCTURE IN WISCONSIN

ADVANCING WEST VIRGINIA'S SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION'S PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY EFFORTS - AS WEST VIRGINIA’S STATE SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION AND AN INTEGRAL PARTNER ON WEST VIRGINIA’S CURRENT RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION (RPE) PROGRAM ADDRESSING SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN THE STATE, THE WEST VIRGINIA FOUNDATION FOR RAPE INFORMATION AND SERVICES (FRIS) PROPOSES TO CONDUCT AN ASSESSMENT OF ITS CAPACITY TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT PRIMARY PREVENTION-FOCUSED STRATEGIES, AND INCORPORATE THOSE FINDINGS INTO A RECOMMENDED PLAN FOR INTEGRATING A HEALTH EQUITY FOCUS INTO FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION STRATEGIES.  THESE RECOMMENDATIONS AND STRATEGIES WILL BE BASED ON DATA TO HELP IDENTIFY THE HEALTH DISPARITIES OF WEST VIRGINIA’S RPE PROGRAM’S TARGET POPULATIONS: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES; CHILDREN AND YOUTH; COLLEGE-AGED ADULTS. FRIS WILL UTILIZE EXISTING AND EXPANDED PARTNERSHIPS WITH EXPERTISE TO BOTH FILL IN CAPACITY GAPS AND COLLABORATE TO BRING AWARENESS TO AND ADDRESS SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND THE CONTRIBUTING INEQUITIES THAT CREATE A DISPROPORTIONATE BURDEN OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE FOR THE TARGET POPULATIONS, AS WELL AS TO MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES SEXUAL VIOLENCE CAUSES. THE INTENDED OUTCOMES AT THE END OF THE ONE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD ARE: -	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES -	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATIONS AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS -	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS -	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY

THE VIRGINIA SEXUAL AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE ACTION ALLIANCE ASSESSMENT OF COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - SEXUAL VIOLENCE (SV) IS A SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM THAT IMPACTS PEOPLE OF ALL AGES, RACES, GENDERS, AND SEXUAL ORIENTATIONS. WHILE SV IMPACTS PEOPLE OF ALL IDENTITIES, SOME GROUPS ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED, INCLUDING WOMEN; RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITIES; LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL, TRANSGENDER, AND QUEER (LGBTQ) PEOPLE; AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH—THE ENVIRONMENTS IN WHICH WE ARE BORN, LIVE, LEARN, WORK, PLAY, WORSHIP, AND AGE—ALSO HAVE A ROLE IN PREVENTING OR FACILITATING VIOLENCE. POVERTY AND LACK OF EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES ARE KNOWN RISK FACTORS FOR SV PERPETRATION.  IN VIRGINIA, RACIAL DISPARITIES IN HEALTH OUTCOMES EXIST; LIFE EXPECTANCY AMONG THE WHITE, NON-HISPANIC POPULATION IN VIRGINIA WAS 78.7 YEARS, COMPARED TO THE BLACK, NON-HISPANIC POPULATION LIFE EXPECTANCY OF 73.9 YEARS. FURTHERMORE, GEOGRAPHIC DISPARITIES IN HEALTH OUTCOMES EXIST IN THE COMMONWEALTH. COUNTIES IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST HEALTH PLANNING REGIONS HAVE POORER HEALTH FACTOR RATINGS, INCLUDING FACTORS SUCH AS ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE, EDUCATION, EMPLOYMENT, FAMILY SUPPORT, AND COMMUNITY SAFETY. OF SIGNIFICANT CONCERN IS AN INCREASED APPARENT RISK FOR INTIMATE PARTNER HOMICIDE, ALSO ON THE BASIS OF RACE AND PLACE. BETWEEN JANUARY 1, 2016, AND DECEMBER 31, 2017, THERE WERE 131 HOMICIDES IN VIRGINIA THAT INVOLVED CURRENT OR FORMER INTIMATE PARTNERS. RISK FOR INTIMATE PARTNER HOMICIDE WAS HIGHEST IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST HEALTH PLANNING REGIONS, WHERE A TOTAL OF 65 FATALITIES OCCURRED DURING THE REPORTED PERIOD. ACROSS THE COMMONWEALTH, BLACK WOMEN DIED AT THREE TIMES THE RATE OF THEIR WHITE FEMALE COUNTERPARTS.  MATERNAL MORTALITY, WHICH IS OFTEN CONSIDERED A GENERAL INDICATOR OF THE OVERALL HEALTH OF A POPULATION AND THE STATUS OF WOMEN IN SOCIETY, MORE THAN DOUBLED BETWEEN 2018 AND 2020 IN VIRGINIA. AMONG BLACK WOMEN IN PARTICULAR, PREGNANCY ASSOCIATED DEATH (DEATHS OCCURRING DURING PREGNANCY OR WITHIN ONE YEAR OF PREGNANCY) IS A SIGNIFICANT HEALTH CONCERN. IN THE TEN-YEAR PERIOD BETWEEN 2004 AND 2013, BLACK WOMEN DIED FROM PREGNANCY ASSOCIATED DEATHS AT 2.3 TIMES THE RATE OF WHITE WOMEN IN VIRGINIA.  GIVEN THE OBSERVED DIFFERENCES IN HEALTH STATUS AND VIOLENCE ON THE BASIS OF RACE AND PLACE, IT IS VITAL THAT SV PREVENTION STRATEGIES IMPLEMENTED IN THE COMMONWEALTH ARE DATA-DRIVEN, HEALTH EQUITY-FOCUSED, AND TAKE CARE TO CENTER MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES. THE VIRGINIA SEXUAL AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE ACTION ALLIANCE (“ACTION ALLIANCE”) SEEKS TO ASSESS AND ENHANCE COALITION CAPACITY TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED SV PRIMARY PREVENTION STRATEGIES. DURING THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE, COALITION STAFF WILL CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF THE COALITION’S READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES (“CAPACITY ASSESSMENT”), WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON DISPARITIES IN REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH. INFORMATION GLEANED FROM THE CAPACITY ASSESSMENT WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP A SERIES OF RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS IN COLLABORATION WITH KEY PARTNERS, INCLUDING STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENT STAFF, TO ADVANCE SV PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES THAT ALSO ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES IN VIRGINIA.  BY THE END OF THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE, THE ACTION ALLIANCE EXPECTS TO HAVE AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES TO IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED SV PREVENTION STRATEGIES; AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS; AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS; AND AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY. THIS INCREASED CAPACITY WILL CONTRIBUTE TO PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTING EQUITY-FOCUSED PREVENTION STRATEGIES, WHICH WILL ULTIMATELY IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR VIRGINIANS EXPERIENCING DISPARITIES AND INEQUITIES RELATED TO SV.

ASSESSING THE PENNSYLVANIA COALITION AGAINST RAPE'S CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - THE PENNSYLVANIA COALITION AGAINST RAPE (PCAR) PROPOSES USING RAPE PREVENTION EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION FUNDS TO COMPLETE A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT TO 1) ASSESS THE COALITION’S INTERNAL UNDERSTANDING OF PRIMARY PREVENTION, 2) IDENTIFY THE COALITION’S CURRENT EXTERNAL PARTNERSHIPS WITH GROUPS WORKING TO PREVENT SEXUAL VIOLENCE, 3) IDENTIFY THE CAPACITY OF COALITION STAFF TO ASSIST WITH PRIMARY PREVENTION RELATED TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE RELATED TO HEALTH EQUITY, AND 4) IDENTIFY COMMUNITY PARTNERS THAT HAVE EXPERTISE WITH IDENTIFIED TARGET POPULATIONS THAT HAVE BEEN HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED WITHIN PENNSYLVANIA COMMUNITIES AND EXPERIENCE HIGHER RATES OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE. THIS WILL HELP INFORM COALITION PREVENTION STAFF OF BOTH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERSHIPS THAT CAN ASSIST WITH TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE REQUESTS RECEIVED FROM PARTNER RAPE CRISIS CENTERS. PCAR RECENTLY COMPLETED A HEALTH EQUITY ASSESSMENT WITH THE CDC RAPE PREVENTION EDUCATION (RPE) SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDS. WITH THE DATA COLLECTED FROM BOTH THE PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT AND THE HEALTH EQUITY ASSESSMENT, PCAR WILL STRENGTHEN CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND THE PENNSYLVANIA COALITION AGAINST DOMESTIC VIOLENCE (PCADV). PCAR WILL ALSO CREATE NEW PARTNERSHIPS WITH GROUPS ALREADY WORKING WITH THE COALITION WHO ARE RECOGNIZED TO HAVE EXPERTISE WITH IDENTIFIED TARGET POPULATIONS. THROUGH THESE PARTNERSHIPS, PCAR WILL CREATE RESOURCES THROUGH PARTNER RECOMMENDATIONS THAT WILL HELP PARTNER RAPE CRISIS CENTERS PROVIDE INCLUSIVE AND ACCESSIBLE PREVENTION EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO THE TARGET POPULATIONS. THESE RESOURCES WILL HELP CENTERS PLAN AND IMPLEMENT PRIMARY PREVENTION INITIATIVES WITHIN THEIR SERVICE AREAS THAT ADDRESS THE HEALTH EQUITY NEEDS OF IDENTIFIED TARGET POPULATIONS.

ASSESSING CAPACITY FOR SEXUAL ASSAULT AND HEALTH EQUITY - ABSTRACT SUMMARY THE DELAWARE ALLIANCE AGAINST SEXUAL VIOLENCE (DAASV)—AN APPROVED STATE SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION NAMED ON THE CDC’S RPE SITE—IS PARTNERING WITH DR. CHERYL M. ACKERMAN, SCIENTIST AT THE CENTER FOR DRUG AND HEALTH STUDIES AT THE UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE, AND HER TEAM TO CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF THE DELAWARE NETWORK COALITION (A COALITION LED BY DAASV) AND DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS. SEXUAL ASSAULT IS A SUBSTANTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUE THAT AFFECTS MILLIONS OF PEOPLE IN THE UNITED STATES EACH YEAR. THE STATE OF DELAWARE IS NO EXCEPTION. ACCORDING NATIONAL INTIMATE PARTNER AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE SURVEY DATA RELEASED IN 2022, 54% OF WOMEN AND 31% OF MEN HAVE EXPERIENCED SOME FORM OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN THEIR LIFETIME. IN DELAWARE, 16.2% OF ADULT WOMEN AND 4% OF MEN REPORTED HAVING BEEN FORCED INTO NON-CONSENSUAL SEX AT SOME POINT DURING THEIR LIVES. FURTHERMORE, THERE ARE DISPARITIES IN DIFFERENT COMMUNITIES’ EXPERIENCE OR PREVALENCE OF SEXUAL ASSAULT, AS WELL AS THEIR ABILITY TO ACCESS BOTH PREVENTATIVE MEASURES AND TREATMENT SERVICES. IN DELAWARE SPECIFICALLY, THE COALITION HAS IDENTIFIED RURAL COMMUNITIES, CHILDREN AND TEENS, CULTURALLY SPECIFIC (BIPOC, MUSLIM, ETC.), LGBTQ, AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AS COMMUNITIES AT HIGH RISK FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND IN NEED OF ADDITIONAL RESOURCES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR DAASV TO IMPROVE ITS ABILITY TO DRIVE EQUITABLE HEALTH OUTCOMES ACROSS ALL DELAWARE COMMUNITIES BY BETTER UNDERSTANDING ITS OWN COALITION’S (THE DELAWARE NETWORK) CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION. THE GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT ARE: - GOAL 1: ASSESS THE INTERNAL CAPACITY OF DAASV AND THE DELAWARE NETWORK COALITION FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION AND ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY IN DELAWARE. - GOAL 2: BASED ON ASSESSMENT DATA, DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS FOR IMPLEMENTING PRIMARY PREVENTION STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES TO ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY IN DELAWARE. PROGRESS TOWARDS THESE GOALS WILL BE DETERMINED BY AN ABILITY TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES RELATED TO PREVENTING SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND PROMOTING HEALTH EQUITY IN DELAWARE: - OUTCOME 1: DEVELOP AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES WITHIN THE DELAWARE NETWORK. - OUTCOME 2: DEVELOP AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS IN DELAWARE. - OUTCOME 3: DEVELOP AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS. - OUTCOME 4: DEVELOP AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY.

ASSESS WCADVSA CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION. - THE PURPOSE OF THIS FUNDING APPLICATION IS TO CONDUCT A CAPACITY ASSESSMENT TO MORE FULLY UNDERSTAND THE READINESS OF WYOMING’S SYSTEMS AND INFRASTRUCTURES TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES THAT ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY WITH AND ON BEHALF OF PEOPLE MOST IMPACTED BY SEXUAL VIOLENCE, INCLUDING PEOPLE OF COLOR, INDIVIDUALS AGES 18-24, AND PEOPLE LIVING WITH LOW INCOMES. THE WCADVSA INTENDS TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES:  INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USES TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, INCLUDING WITH STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENT, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISIONS AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY; AND INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF COALITION AND PARTNER ENGAGEMENT.

RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - PROPOSED PROJECT. THE CAWS NORTH DAKOTA RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION (RPE): ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION PROJECT WILL ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN CAWS NORTH DAKOTA'S/THE COALITION'S PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE (SV) BY: --CONDUCTING A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF THE COALITION THAT WILL INCREASE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERIENCE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES FOR SV PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS IN OUR STATE, AND INCREASE THE COALITION'S CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT SV PREVENTION STRATEGIES THAT INCORPORATE HEALTH EQUITY. --DEVELOPING RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS THAT WILL ADVANCE THE COALITION'S SV PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES ADDRESSING HEALTH INEQUITIES INCLUDING: AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE GREATEST NEED FOCUS POPULATIONS/COMMUNITIES DATA SOURCES AND STRENGTHENED DATA-DRIVEN SV PREVENTION PROGRAMMING; ENHANCED AND ALIGNED PRIMARY PREVENTION/HEALTH EQUITY PARTNERSHIPS SUPPORTING EXPANSION OF HEALTH EQUITY WORK; IMPROVED HEALTH EQUITY AND ADVANCED SV PRIMARY PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION. WE REQUEST $125,830.00 FROM THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION, NATIONAL CENTER FOR INJURY PREVENTION AND CONTROL, RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION PROGRAM. WHO WILL BE INVOLVED. CAWS NORTH DAKOTA WILL BE THE LEAD APPLICANT ON THIS PROJECT AND WILL BE WORKING WITH EXPERIENCED CONSULTANT/CONTRACTOR GLOBAL RIGHTS FOR WOMEN (GRW) AS WELL AS PARTNERS WITH EXPERTISE IN SV PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY INCLUDING THE RPE-FUNDED NORTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (NDDHHS) AND CDC-FUNDED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDERS TO COMPLETE THE COALITION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP THE RESULTING RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS.

THE NEBRASKA COALITION RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION GRANT WILL SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PREVENTION EFFORTS ACROSS NEBRASKA AND ITS NETWORK OF PROGRAMS. - THE COALITION WILL USE THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY TO ASSESS AND STRENGTHEN ITS PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE STRATEGIES AND INCORPORATE ACTIVITIES THAT ADDRESS THE HEALTH INEQUITIES THAT CREATE A DISPROPORTIONATE BURDEN OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE ON HISTORICALLY OPPRESSED AND MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES INTO ITS WORK. BY THE END OF THE FUNDING GRANT PERIOD, THE COALITION EXPECTS TO INCREASE ITS UNDERSTANDING OF THE FOLLOWING FACTORS THAT AFFECT THE COALITION’S ABILITY TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGIES IN NEBRASKA: - COALITION STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES; - AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES TO IDENTIFY POPULATIONS AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS; - CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THEY ARE OR ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS; - CURRENT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION, AND HOW WELL THEY INCORPORATE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY; AND - COALITION AND PARTNER ENGAGEMENT.

MONTANA - ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - MONTANA COALITION AGAINST DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE PROJECT ABSTRACT MARCH 2023 THE MONTANA COALITION AGAINST DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE (MCADSV) SUBMITS THIS APPLICATION FOR THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC), NATIONAL CENTER FOR INJURY PREVENTION AND CONTROL, RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION, CDC-RFA-CE-23-0006 FUNDING ANNOUNCEMENT. MCADSV IS THE CDC DESIGNATED STATE SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION FOR THE STATE OF MONTANA. MCADSV WAS A PRIOR GRANTEE OF THE CDC UNDER THE DELTA PREVENTION PROJECT. MCADSV IS ALIGNED WITH THE STATEMENT OF PURPOSE IN THE FUNDING ANNOUNCEMENT. WE BELIEVE THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY WILL ALLOW US TO BEGIN TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES IN A MEANINGFUL WAY. THE FUNDING IS VERY LIMITED, SO OUR ABILITY TO FULLY ADDRESS THE PURPOSE WILL BE IMPACTED BY THAT LIMITATION. BUT WE WILL DO WHAT WE CAN WITH THE RESOURCES PROVIDED. IT IS ALWAYS WORTH NOTING THAT MONTANA IS A SIGNIFICANTLY LARGE GEOGRAPHICALLY, LOW-POPULATION DENSITY STATE WITH A GREAT DEAL OF DISTANCE AND LIMITED ORGANIZATIONAL/SERVICE PROVIDER CAPACITY. A STATEWIDE PROJECT IS OFTEN NOT REALISTIC UNLESS THE FUNDING IS APPROPRIATE FOR THE NEED. WE WILL NEED TO FOCUS OUR INTENTION AND ACTIVITIES ON THE THINGS WE CAN ADDRESS WITH THE RESOURCES PROVIDED. ACCORDING TO THE FUNDING ANNOUNCEMENT, OUR OUTCOMES FOR THIS FUNDING PERIOD SHOULD BE AS FOLLOWS: INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OR STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES, INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATIONS AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS, INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEED, INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY. WE COMMIT TO ACCOMPLISHING THESE OUTCOMES TO THE BEST OF OUR ABILITY IN THE TIME ALLOWED. THE PROJECT WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED WITH A TEAM APPROACH. ALL CURRENT MCADSV STAFF ARE WELL SUITED TO ADMINISTER THIS PROJECT AND HAVE EXTENSIVE HISTORY AND WORK EXPERIENCE ON THESE ISSUES. WE WILL UTILIZE EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS AND DEVELOP NEW ONES AS NECESSARY. WE WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE STATE RPE ADMINISTRATOR AS WE ARE ABLE.

MOCADSV ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - SEXUAL VIOLENCE IS A SIGNIFICANT CONCERN FOR MISSOURIANS AND ANNUALLY IMPACTS THOUSANDS OF LIVES IN MISSOURI. IN 2021, DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE AGENCIES ACROSS MISSOURI PROVIDED SEXUAL VIOLENCE SERVICES TO 6,656 INDIVIDUALS AND ANSWERED 9,201 SEXUAL VIOLENCE-RELATED HOTLINE CALLS. DURING THE ONE-WEEK MOCADSV SEXUAL VIOLENCE POINT-IN-TIME COUNT FROM SEPTEMBER 20 TO 27, 2021, 773 INDIVIDUALS SOUGHT SERVICES FROM MISSOURI AGENCIES. ACCORDING TO THE MISSOURI HIGHWAY PATROL, THERE WERE 3,317 REPORTED INCIDENTS OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN 2021. RESEARCH ALSO SHOWS US THAT GENDER MINORITIES EXPERIENCE DISPROPORTIONATELY HIGHER RATES OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE THAN THEIR HETEROSEXUAL PEERS. MISSOURI COALITION AGAINST DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE (MOCADSV) WILL USE FUNDING FROM THE CENTER FOR DISEASE CONTROL RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION GRANT TO INCREASE MOCADSV’S CAPACITY TO PROVIDE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION SERVICES AND ADDRESS THE HEALTH DISPARITIES FOR THE LGBTQ+ TARGET POPULATION. MOCADSV WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS BY INCREASING STAFF KNOWLEDGE OF HEALTH EQUITY AS SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND INCORPORATING PREVENTION EXPERTISE INTO ALL DEPARTMENTS. MOCADSV WILL ALSO INCREASE PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS TO INCLUDE ADDITIONAL EXPERTISE AND SKILLS ON HEALTH INEQUITIES AND THE NEEDS OF MISSOURI’S LGBTQ+ COMMUNITIES. MOCADSV WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS OBJECTIVE BY IDENTIFYING KEY COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS AND ENGAGING THEIR PARTICIPATION IN PROJECT ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, MOCADSV WILL ASSESS MISSOURI DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE AGENCIES’ CAPACITY TO PROVIDE PRIMARY PREVENTION SERVICES AND INCORPORATE LGBTQ+ SPECIFIC SERVICES INTO THEIR RESPECTIVE PROGRAMS. MOCADSV WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS OBJECTIVE THROUGH DISSEMINATION OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES, CONDUCTING CAPACITY ASSESSMENTS OF MEMBER AGENCIES AND COLLABORATIVE PARTNERS, PROVIDING TOPIC-SPECIFIC TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SERVICES, AND DEVELOPING ACTION STRATEGIES TO BUILD MISSOURI’S OVERALL CAPACITY FOR SEXUAL ASSAULT PREVENTION.

FY 2023 CDC-RPE: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - THE MINNESOTA COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (MNCASA) SEEKS SUPPORT FROM THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION'S RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION FUNDING OPPORTUNITY (CDC-RFA-CE-23-0006). THROUGH THIS SUPPORT, MNCASA'S PREVENTION PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE STRENGTHENING AND LEADING SEXUAL ASSAULT PREVENTION EFFORTS ACROSS THE STATE OF MINNESOTA BY APPLYING EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES INFORMED BY A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT. DATA-DRIVEN APPROACHES, PARTNERSHIP-BUILDING, AND ASSESSMENTS WILL BE USED TO ADDRESS DISPARITIES AND INEQUITIES ACROSS MINNESOTA'S DIVERSE COMMUNITIES. MNCASA IS REQUESTING $125,830.00 FOR THE 1-YEAR PERFORMANCE LENGTH.

ASSESSING THE CONNECTICUT ALLIANCE TO END SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS - PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY  PREVENTING AND ENDING CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE, AND ALL SEXUAL VIOLENCE, IS NOT ONLY POSSIBLE BUT A SOCIAL AND MORAL IMPERATIVE. THE CONNECTICUT ALLIANCE TO END SEXUAL VIOLENCE RECOGNIZES THE NEED FOR A COLLECTIVE, MULTI-SECTORAL EFFORT AND COMMITMENT. THIS PROPOSAL OUTLINES THE ALLIANCE’S APPROACH TO ASSESSING THE CAPACITY OF THE STATE-WIDE ANTI-SEXUAL VIOLENCE COALITION AND ITS MANY COMMUNITY AND STATE PARTNERS TO USE AVAILABLE DATA AND GATHER NEW QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DATA TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE STATE’S ASSETS THAT CAN BE BETTER HARNESSED AS WELL AS GAPS THAT CAN BE FILLED IN ORDER TO INCREASE AND IMPROVE PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS. BY THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PROJECT PERIOD, THE ALLIANCE ANTICIPATES ACHIEVING THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES THROUGH THE CAPACITY ASSESSMENT PROCESS AND EVALUATION: 	IMPROVED PARTNERSHIPS WITH STAKEHOLDERS INTERESTED IN PREVENTING SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND INCREASING HEALTH EQUITY. 	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF EXISTING OBSTACLES AND FACILITATORS OF PRIMARY PREVENTION PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION. 	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF AND LEADERSHIP ABILITY AND COMMITMENT TO IMPLEMENT PRIMARY PREVENTION PROGRAMS THROUGH THE FRAMEWORK OF THE NINE PRINCIPLES OF PREVENTION. 	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF COMMUNITY LEVEL DATA SOURCES AVAILABLE TO HELP IN THE IDENTIFICATION OF POPULATIONS AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS. 	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF PARTNER CHARACTERISTICS THAT FACILITATE AND CHALLENGE COLLABORATIVE ENGAGEMENT IN PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES. 	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT ASPECTS OF THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THE ALLIANCE PROVIDES ARE HAVING AN IMPACT AND CHANGING THE WAYS PREVENTION EDUCATION IS BEING DELIVERED, AND HOW WELL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY. 	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT ADDITIONAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FROM THE ALLIANCE IS NEEDED TO INCREASE THE ADOPTION OF PRIMARY PREVENTION AND EVIDENCE-BASED APPROACHES.

RPE - ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - SEXUAL VIOLENCE IS ASSOCIATED WITH POOR HEALTH OUTCOMES (PHYSICAL AND MENTAL), AND THIS IS OFTEN EXACERBATED BY INEQUITIES THAT MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES MOST OFTEN AFFECTED BY IT FACE. TO ADDRESS THIS PROBLEM, NJCASA WILL CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF READINESS TO PLAN FOR AND IMPLEMENT A SERIES OF EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES; ADDITIONALLY, WE WILL DEVELOP AND SHARE RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY BASED ON OUR ASSESSMENT FINDINGS. THROUGHOUT, WE WILL USE A DATA-CENTERED APPROACH, AND PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSESSING EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS TO DETERMINE GAPS, AS WELL AS IDENTIFYING COLLABORATIVE OPPORTUNITIES TO ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY ACROSS A NETWORK OF PARTNERS TO MAXIMIZE PROJECT IMPACT. THIS PROCESS WILL CULMINATE IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF EVIDENCE-BASED RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS TO ADVANCE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES THAT ALSO ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES, SPECIFICALLY ONES WHICH CAN BE CARRIED OUT IN COLLABORATION WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO EXPAND OUR REACH.  FURTHERMORE, THE PROJECT WILL DELVE INTO NUANCED ASPECTS OF NJCASA’S EXISTING WORK, SUCH AS EVALUATING  THE ORGANIZATION’S POLICY CAPACITY AND RELATED AREAS THAT NEED TO BE STRENGTHENED, INCLUDING STAFF KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY TO ENGAGE WITH LEGISLATURE TO INCREASE OUR IMPACT AROUND HEALTH EQUITY. IT WILL ALSO INCLUDE ASSESSING CULTURAL COMPETENCY AND CULTURAL HUMILITY, AS PER OUR CURRENT EVIDENCE-BASED OFFERINGS, TO DETERMINE IF THEY ARE HAVING THE DESIRED EFFECT ON OUR COMMUNITIES AND IF THEY ARE ACCESSIBLE AND INCLUSIVE. FINALLY, IT WILL EXPLORE COLLABORATIONS WITH NON-TRADITIONAL PARTNERS TO BRIDGE THE GAP BETWEEN MAINSTREAM SYSTEMS AND HYPER-LOCAL COMMUNITY-ROOTED SPACES OF INTERACTION WHERE IDEAS AND MESSAGES ARE REINFORCED, SUCH AS BARBERSHOPS AND HAIR SALONS.

IOWACASA  RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT - THE IOWA COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (IOWACASA) IS SEEKING SUPPORT FROM THE RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION (RPE): ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION FUNDING OPPORTUNITY SO THAT WE CAN TAKE A STEP BACK FROM THE WORK AS WE HAVE HISTORICALLY DONE IT, ASSESS WHAT IS WORKING, WHAT IS NOT, AND WHAT GAPS CONTINUE TO EXIST. WE HOPE TO COLLECT DATA AND BUILD NEW COLLABORATIVE RELATIONSHIPS THAT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO OUR STATEWIDE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION PLAN AND HELP GUIDE OUR STATE AS WE MOVE INTO THE NEXT RPE PROJECT PERIOD. FINALLY, WE HOPE THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW US TO BUILD CAPACITY TO MOVE FROM A FEW PROGRAMS ALL DOING MEANINGFUL BUT DISCONNECTED WORK TO A MORE COHESIVE PLAN FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION ACROSS THE STATE THAT IS ROOTED IN HEALTH EQUITY FOR ALL IOWANS, BUT ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO ARE CURRENTLY EXPERIENCING SYSTEMIC INEQUITIES AND INCREASED RISK OF VIOLENCE.  AS REQUIRED, IOWACASA PLANS TO CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT AND TO USE THE INFORMATION GAINED FROM THAT ASSESSMENT TO DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS TO ADVANCE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES THAT ALSO ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES.  THE THREE PRIMARY OUTCOMES THAT WE ARE HOPING TO ACHIEVE WITH THIS FUNDING SOURCE ARE: 1) INCREASED CAPACITY OF IOWACASA AND POTENTIAL SUBCONTRACTORS TO IMPLEMENT DATA-DRIVEN PRIMARY PREVENTION WITH A HEALTH EQUITY FOCUS; 2) INCREASED AVAILABILITY OF IOWA-FOCUSED DATA ON SEXUAL VIOLENCE PERPETRATION; AND 3) INCREASED COLLABORATIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH ORGANIZATIONS THAT WORK WITH DISABLED IOWANS AND THEIR FAMILIES.  TO INCREASE THE INTERNAL CAPACITY OF IOWACASA AND OUR SUBCONTRACTORS, WE WILL UTILIZE THE ASSESSMENT TOOLS AVAILABLE ON VETOVIOLENCE TO COLLECT DATA FROM OUR STAFF AND SUBCONTRACTORS, AND THEN WE WILL RESERVE A PORTION OF OUR INTERNAL STAFF MEETINGS AND SCHEDULED SUBCONTRACTOR TA TIME TO REVIEW THAT DATA AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ACTION STEPS TO ADDRESS ANY DEFICIENCIES WE IDENTIFY.  TO INCREASE THE AVAILABILITY OF IOWA-FOCUSED DATA ON SEXUAL VIOLENCE PERPETRATION, WE WILL COLLECT AND REVIEW ANY ACTUAL INSTRUMENTS THAT WE AND OUR PARTNERS HAVE ACCESS TO (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO INTAKE FORMS, STATEWIDE AND PROGRAMMATIC SURVEYS, AND LAW ENFORCEMENT DATA) TO ASSESS PLACES WHERE QUESTIONS ON PERPETRATION COULD REASONABLY BE ASKED. THEN WE WILL WORK WITH OUR PARTNERS TO DETERMINE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR NEXT STEPS TO MOVE FORWARD BEGINNING TO COLLECT THAT DATA.  TO INCREASE OUR COLLABORATIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH ORGANIZATIONS THAT WORK WITH DISABLED IOWANS AND THEIR FAMILIES, WE WILL BUILD OUR OWN CAPACITY AND EXPERTISE IN THIS AREA BY CERTIFYING SEVERAL STAFF AND PARTNERS IN WITH PREVENT CHILD ABUSE VERMONT’S “NURTURING AND SAFE ENVIRONMENTS FOR CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES” CURRICULUM AND THEN OFFERING THAT CURRICULUM FREE OF CHARGE TO ORGANIZATIONS AROUND THE STATE TO HELP BUILD TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS AND BEGIN CONVERSATIONS ABOUT MEANINGFUL DATA SHARING AND COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS.

RPE ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - THE KANSAS COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE (KCSDV) IS A STATEWIDE COALITION COMPRISED OF DIRECT SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDING ESSENTIAL SERVICES TO KANSAS VICTIMS-SURVIVORS OF SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, STALKING, AND DATING VIOLENCE. KCSDV IS THE FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED AND DESIGNATED STATE DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION IN KANSAS. THIS RECOGNITION COMES FROM THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE OFFICE ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN, AND THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION.  THERE IS STILL MUCH WORK THAT NEEDS TO BE DONE TO ADEQUATELY ADDRESS THE PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN KANSAS. KCSDV WILL BEGIN THIS WORK BY COMPLETING A CAPACITY ASSESSMENT AROUND PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY. IN COLLABORATION WITH OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, KCSDV WILL USE THE DATA GATHERED IN THIS PROCESS TO DEVELOP ACTION STEPS TO ADVANCE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES THAT ALSO ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES.  KCSDV HAS IDENTIFIED THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES THAT WILL BE ACHIEVED BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD:  OUTCOME 1: KCSDV WILL HAVE INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES.  OUTCOME 2: KCSDV WILL HAVE INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS.  OUTCOME 3: KCSDV WILL HAVE INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS.  OUTCOME 4: KCSDV WILL HAVE INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY.

RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD AND ENHANCE THE PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY OF THE INDIANA SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITIONS IN PREPARATION FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGY IMPLEMENTATION FOCUSED ON ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY. DURING THIS ONE-YEAR FUNDING OPPORTUNITY THE INDIANA COALITION TO END SEXUAL ASSAULT [D.B.A INDIANA COALITION TO END SEXUAL ASSAULT AND HUMAN TRAFFICKING (ICESAHT)] WILL CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES, DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY, AND ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION IN FUTURE WORK. THIS ASSESSMENT WILL BE OF OUR ORGANIZATION AS WELL AS WITH INDIANA COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES AS MEMBERS OF THE INDIANA STATE CAMPUS CONSORTIUM, MADE UP OF CAMPUS SEXUAL ASSAULT PREVENTION LEADERS.  ICESAHT WILL USE A DATA-DRIVEN APPROACH TO ADDRESS PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES WITHIN INDIANA’S HIGHER EDUCATION SYSTEM WITH A HIGH BURDEN OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE (SV), ASSESS EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS TO DETERMINE GAPS, AND IDENTIFY COLLABORATIVES TO ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY AND ALIGN COALITION AND STATE RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION (RPE) PROGRAM PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS. COMPLETING THE ASSESSMENT WILL LEAD TO INCREASED ABILITY TO UNDERSTAND AND ADDRESS THE INEQUITIES THAT CREATE A DISPROPORTIONATE BURDEN OF SV. THIS WORK HELPS BUILD THE FOUNDATION FOR COALITIONS TO DEVELOP RECOMMENDATION TO ENHANCE, EXPAND, AND STRENGTHEN PRIMARY SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS, ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES, INCREASE THE USE OF DATA TO INFORM PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS AND CREATE MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT WITH STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, STATE SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITIONS, CULTURALLY SPECIFIC ORGANIZATIONS, AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN THE RPE PROGRAM.

ASSESSING ICASA'S CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - THE ILLINOIS COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (ICASA) SEEKS TO CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF COALITION’S READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES. THE CAPACITY ASSESSMENT WILL INCLUDE THREE MAIN COMPONENTS: A) INTERNAL CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF STAFFING, RESOURCES, AND SKILLS; B) DATA GATHERING AND ANALYSIS TO DETERMINE TARGET COMMUNITIES AND POPULATIONS; AND C) EXTERNAL CAPACITY ASSESSMENT WITH PARTNERS IN PREVENTION TO IDENTIFY AREAS OF GREATEST NEED OR GAPS IN CURRENT ILLINOIS SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS. ICASA WILL WORK WITH MULTI-SECTOR PARTNERS INCLUDING THOSE BOTH CURRENTLY ENGAGED IN SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION AS WELL AS THOSE ADDRESSING OR IMPACTED BY VIOLENCE BROADLY INCLUDING THE STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, CURRENT SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION IMPLEMENTORS, PUBLIC AND PRIVATE HEALTH AND EDUCATION ORGANIZATIONS, CULTURALLY SPECIFIC ORGANIZATIONS, AND SURVIVORS. USING THE DATA-DRIVEN CAPACITY ASSESSMENT, ICASA WILL WORK WITH COLLABORATIVE STATEWIDE PARTNERS TO DEVELOP AN ACTION PLAN FOR THE COALITION WHICH INCLUDES RECOMMENDED EVIDENCE-INFORMED, HEALTH EQUITY FOCUSED, PRIMARY PREVENTION STRATEGIES AT THE OUTER LEVELS OF THE SOCIAL ECOLOGICAL MODEL WHICH ADDRESSED UNSERVED OR UNDERSERVED NEEDS IN CURRENT PREVENTION EFFORTS, SUPPORTS AND COMPLEMENTS CURRENT PARTNER’S STRATEGIES, AND IMPROVES HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR THE ILLINOIS COMMUNITIES WITH THE GREATEST NEEDS. SELECTED STRATEGIES WILL ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES WHICH CREATE DISPROPORTIONATE BURDEN OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND BRING AWARENESS AND HELP PREVENT SEXUAL ASSAULT.

THE ACASA WILL CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT ITS READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGIES AND DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT - THE ACASA WILL CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF THE ACASA'S READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGIES AND DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY AND ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION. THE PROJECT WILL ENHANCE THE EXPERTISE OF THE COALITION IN PRIMARY PREVENTION, HEALTH INEQUITIES FOCUS, INCREASED THE USE OF DATA TO INFORM PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS, ESTABLISHED PARTNERSHIPS THAT INCREASE THE COALITION'S ABILITY TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF POPULATIONS, IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR INDIVIDUALS, COMMUNITIES, AND COMMUNITIES IN THE POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF GREATEST NEED MOST AFFECTED BY SEXUAL VIOLENCE. OUTCOMES WILL BE ACHIEVED BY MAY 31, 2024, AND WILL INCREASE THE UNDERSTANDING OF ACASA STAFF EXPERTISE AND INCREASE AVAILABLE RESOURCES. CAPACITY OF THE COALITION WILL BE INCREASED BY THE UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES IN ARKANSAS THAT MAY BE USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS AND INCREASE THE UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT ACASA PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS. AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF ACASA’S CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY WILL ALSO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE COALITION TO PROVIDE THIS TYPE OF ASSISTANCE IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHER CDC RAPE PREVENTION EDUCATION FUNDED PROGRAMS WITHIN THE STATE OF ARKANSAS.

IDAHO COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL & DOMESTIC VIOLENCE: CULTIVANDO NUESTRAS HERMANAS CON ESPERANZA Y FORTALEZA - THE PURPOSE OF THE IDAHO COALITION CULTIVANDO NUESTRAS HERMANAS CON ESPERANZA Y FORTALEZA  IS TO BUILD AND ENHANCE OUR INTERNAL PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY TO PREPARE FOR A COMPREHENSIVE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGY AND IMPLEMENTATION FOCUSED ON ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY FOR LATINX WOMEN AND GIRLS WHO WORK IN THE AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY. THIS ONE-YEAR PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE IDAHO COALITION TO CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT HEALTH EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES SPECIFIC TO THE LATINX WOMEN AND GIRLS WORKING IN THE AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY, DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY, AND TO BEGIN TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF LATINX FARMWORKER ORGANIZATIONS AND COMMUNITY SEXUAL VIOLENCE PROGRAMS TO ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY AND PRIMARY PREVENTION STRATEGIES.

NCEDSV PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT - PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY SEXUAL VIOLENCE (SV) IS A TRAUMATIC EXPERIENCE FOR TOO MANY NEVADANS IMPARTING LIFE-LONG PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH CONSEQUENCES.  ACCORDING TO THE US DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE 2019 CRIME IN THE US REPORT, NEVADA RANKS FIFTH IN THE COUNTRY FOR MOST RAPES PER CAPITA AT 67 RAPES PER 100,000 RESIDENTS.  NEVADA’S UNIFIED CRIME REPORTING SYSTEM FOUND THAT IN 2022 RAPE ACCOUNTED FOR 12.8% OF ALL VIOLENT CRIMES REPORTED BY LAW ENFORCEMENT.  DESPITE THIS HIGH INCIDENCE OF RAPE, THERE CONTINUES TO BE ONLY ONE RAPE CRISIS CENTER IN THE STATE AND A LACK OF SV PREVENTION AND EDUCATION SERVICES.  THIS EXPERIENCE IS COMPOUNDED FOR THOSE COMMUNITIES EXPERIENCING SYSTEMIC OPPRESSION AND INEQUITIES. WITH THIS FUNDING NCEDSV WILL COMPLETE A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT WHICH WILL IDENTIFY CURRENT RESOURCES AND GAPS IN THE AREAS OF PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY.  FOLLOWING THE CAPACITY ASSESSMENT, NCEDSV WILL IDENTIFY HEALTH INEQUITIES THAT ARE NEGATIVELY IMPACTING ACCESS TO SV SERVICES FOR TARGETED POPULATIONS.  USING THAT INFORMATION, NCEDSV WILL DEVELOP A SET OF RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS SPECIFIC TO THE UNIQUE LANDSCAPE OF NEVADA WHICH WILL ALLOW US TO MOVE FORWARD IN ADVANCING PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES THAT BUILD HEALTHIER COMMUNITIES WHILE ADDRESSING SYSTEMIC INEQUITY.

ASSESSING CAPACITY FOR HEALTH EQUITY IN LOUISIANA - THE LOUISIANA FOUNDATION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (LAFASA) SEEKS TO REDUCE LOUISIANA’S SIGNIFICANT HEALTH AND SOCIOECONOMIC DISPARITIES AS WELL AS THE INCIDENCE OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN THE STATE. THIS REQUIRES AN ASSESSMENT OF THE CURRENT CAPACITY AND STATEWIDE SOCIOECONOMIC FACTORS THAT IMPACT HEALTH EQUITY AND INEQUITIES. THE STATE COALITION WILL CONTRACT WITH AN AGENCY TO SERVE AS THE HEALTH EQUITY ASSESSMENT COORDINATOR. THE ASSESSMENT COORDINATOR WILL CONDUCT INTERVIEWS AND FOCUS GROUPS WITH RPE-FUNDED SEXUAL ASSAULT CENTERS, ACCREDITED SEXUAL ASSAULT CENTERS WHO DO NOT RECEIVE RPE FUNDING, INDIVIDUALS AT THE STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENT, AND OTHER CURRENT AND PROSPECTIVE PARTNERS IN PRIMARY PREVENTION, INCLUDING COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. THESE INTERACTIONS WILL BE IN-PERSON AND VIRTUAL, BASED ON PARTICIPANT ABILITY, AND WILL OCCUR DURING ONE-ON-VISITS, SCHEDULED REGIONAL MEETINGS, AND THE PREVENTIONISTS/ADVOCATES OF COLOR ROUNDTABLE THAT LAFASA HOSTS. THE RESULT OF THIS WILL BE THE IDENTIFICATION OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES TO IDENTIFY POPULATIONS AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS, AN ANALYSIS OF PARTNERSHIPS AND GAPS, AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE EXTENT TO WHICH CURRENT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY IN LOUISIANA. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO SEEK TO OFFER MORE EQUITY-FOCUSED, COMMUNITY-DRIVEN TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, THROUGH A STATEWIDE SUMMIT, VIRTUAL TRAININGS, AND ATTENDANCE AT THE NATIONAL SEXUAL ASSAULT CONFERENCE.
NMCSAP PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT

ASSESSING OAESV CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION IN OHIO - SEXUAL VIOLENCE IS AN URGENT PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM THAT AFFECTS MILLIONS OF PEOPLE NATIONWIDE AND WITHIN OHIO. WHILE ANY PERSON CAN EXPERIENCE SEXUAL VIOLENCE, DISPROPORTIONATE RATES OF VIOLENCE ARE SEEN IN GROUPS WITH MARGINALIZED IDENTITIES, LEADING TO INEQUITIES IN HEALTH AND WELLBEING. IN ORDER TO FULLY ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES, VIOLENCE PREVENTION MUST BE INCLUDED IN EFFORTS AND PRIORITIZED. THROUGH THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY, THE OHIO ALLIANCE TO END SEXUAL VIOLENCE WILL EXAMINE ITS ABILITY TO PROVIDE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION ACTIVITIES THAT ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES THAT CREATE DISPROPORTIONATE RISK FOR SOME OF OHIO’S POPULATIONS. GAPS IN PROVIDING EQUITABLE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND CREATING DIVERSE PARTNERSHIPS WILL BE DETERMINED AND ADDRESSED THROUGH A SET OF RECOMMENDATIONS. UNDERSTANDING AND INCREASING THE COALITION’S CAPACITY TO ADDRESS HEALTH EQUITY AND ITS PARTNERSHIPS WILL DIRECTLY RESULT IN BETTER SERVICES AND INCREASED WELLBEING FOR OHIOANS. DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD, OHIO ALLIANCE TO END SEXUAL VIOLENCE IS EXPECTED TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES: 1)	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES 2)	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS 3)	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS 4)	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY TWO MAIN ACTIVITIES WILL TAKE PLACE DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD. FIRST, THE COALITION WILL IMPLEMENT AN INTERNAL PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT. A SURVEY WILL BE USED TO COLLECT INFORMATION ON THE COALITION’S STAFF KNOWLEDGE, RESOURCES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION, AND PARTNERSHIPS. AFTER THIS INFORMATION IS COLLECTED, THE COALITION WILL GATHER STAKEHOLDERS FROM BOTH STATEWIDE ORGANIZATIONS AS WELL AS LOCAL PROGRAMS TO REVIEW THE RESULTS AND DEVELOP A SET OF RECOMMENDATIONS TO FILL ANY GAPS. AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, THE COALITION WILL HAVE A SET OF RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS, AS WELL A SET OF OUTCOMES TO IMPROVE UPON.

PREVENTING VIOLENCE THROUGH ARIZONA COALITION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT - ARIZONA IS EXPERIENCING A PUBLIC HEALTH CRISIS DUE TO SEXUAL VIOLENCE (SV) WITH 42.6% OF WOMEN AND 33.4% OF MEN REPORTING EXPERIENCES OF SV. OUR INDIGENOUS, RURAL, AND SPANISH-SPEAKING COMMUNITIES EXPERIENCE SV AT CONSIDERABLY HIGHER RATES THAN THE GENERAL POPULATION WITH BETWEEN ONE-THIRD AND TWO-THIRDS OF THESE COMMUNITIES REPORTING SV AT LEAST ONCE IN THEIR LIVES. TO ACHIEVE HEALTH EQUITY AND PREVENT SV, WE MUST WORK TO ELIMINATE THE AVOIDABLE SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DISPARITIES THAT LEAD TO THESE UNJUST CIRCUMSTANCES AND INCREASE ECONOMIC AND HEALTHCARE OPPORTUNITIES.  ARIZONA’S HIGH SV RATES ARE LINKED TO LOW SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH AND OPPRESSIVE SOCIAL AND GOVERNMENTAL SYSTEMS. MANY OF THE RISK FACTORS IN THESE COMMUNITIES ARE CORRELATED WITH GENERATIONS OF COLONIZATION AND GENERATIONAL TRAUMA IN INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES, POVERTY IN RURAL AREAS THAT LEAD TO LOW QUALITY ECONOMIC, XENOPHOBIC POLICY THAT MARGINALIZES SPANISH-SPEAKERS, AND HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES THAT ARE NOT EFFECTIVE IN PROTECTING AGAINST SV. CONSIDERING THE HIGH-RISK SOCIAL FACTORS FOR SV IN THESE COMMUNITIES, WE MUST INVEST IN PREVENTATIVE SERVICES FOR SV IN ARIZONA.  HOWEVER, IT IS UNKNOWN HOW MUCH CAPACITY SERVICE PROVIDERS IN ARIZONA HAVE TO PRIMARILY PREVENT SV. MOREOVER, THE ARIZONA COALITION TO END SEXUAL AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE (ACESDV) HAS MINIMAL EXPERIENCE TRAINING, OFFERING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND COLLABORATING WITH SV PARTNERS FOR PRIMARY SV PREVENTION. WE REQUIRE A READINESS ASSESSMENT AND EVIDENCE-BASED APPROACH TO EXPANDING ARIZONA’S SV PREVENTION WORK. THE PURPOSE OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL UTILIZE A PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACH TO FOR A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT FOR SV BY 1. ASSESSING OUR STATE COALITION STAFF’S EXPERTISE AND DEDICATED TIME TO ADDRESS SV PREVENTION; 2. ASSESS OUR EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS AND GAPS IN SERVICES FOR SV PREVENTION; 3. ASSESS OUR STATE COALITION’S ACCESS TO RELIABLE AND UP-TO-DATE DATA ON SV AND SV PRIMARY PREVENTION IN THE STATE OF ARIZONA; 4. ASSESS OUR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION TO ENSURE THE EFFICACY OF THIS APPROACH. THE OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE: INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS; AND INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY.

RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION: ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION FOR CALIFORNIA - VALORUS (VALOR), CALIFORNIA’S STATE SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION, WILL CONDUCT A CAPACITY ASSESSMENT AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS ON ITS CURRENT CAPACITY TO ENHANCE AND EXPAND PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK, WITH A FOCUS ON STAFFING AND RESOURCES, SKILLS AND EXPERTISE, COLLABORATION AND PARTNERSHIPS, AND DATA AND EVALUATION.
ASSESSING DCCESV CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION IN WASHINGTON, DC

ASSESSING THE CAPACITY OF THE MAINE COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY. - THE PROPOSED PROJECT SEEKS TO ASSESS AND BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE MAINE COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (MECASA) AND ITS PARTNERS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGIES TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY AND ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION IN MAINE, ESPECIALLY IN COMMUNITIES HISTORICALLY OPPRESSED BY HIGHER RATES OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE. MECASA PLANS TO CONTRACT WITH A CONSULTANT WITH A BACKGROUND IN SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND/OR HEALTH EQUITY TO PERFORM A CAPACITY ASSESSMENT USING THE TOOL AND GUIDANCE PROVIDED BY THE CDC.  THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT AS PROPOSED, MECASA EXPECTS TO ACHIEVE ALL THE SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES IDENTIFIED IN THE LOGIC MODEL INCLUDED IN THE APPROACH SECTION OF THE CDC PROJECT DESCRIPTION. THESE OUTCOMES INCLUDE: -	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES -	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS -	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS -	INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY

THE NHCADSV IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE PRIMARY PREVENTION PROGRAMMING ACROSS THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE, SEEKING TO PREVENT VIOLENCE BEFORE IT STARTS. - THE NEW HAMPSHIRE COALITION AGAINST DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE (NHCADSV) SEEKS TO STRENGTHEN AND ENHANCE NEW HAMPSHIRE’S SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAM BY INCREASING ITS CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGIES FOCUSED ON ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY. WITH THE HELP OF AN EVALUATOR, NHCADSV WILL CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT AND A PROCESS EVALUATION TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE INEQUITABLE FACTORS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO HIGHER RATES OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS, AND IMPLEMENT ACTION STEPS TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION THAT ADDRESSES HEALTH INEQUITY. THROUGH THIS PROCESS, NHCADSV AND ITS MEMBER PROGRAMS WILL UTILIZE AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES TO BETTER INFORM THEIR PREVENTION PROGRAMMING, STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS WITH PUBLIC HEALTH AND CULTURALLY SPECIFIC COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO BETTER SUPPORT TARGET POPULATIONS, AND INCREASE TRAINING AND RESOURCES AT BOTH THE COALITION AND MEMBER PROGRAM LEVELS TO ENSURE THAT PREVENTION EDUCATORS ARE MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY NEEDS ACROSS THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE.

CDC GRANT TO STATE SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITIONS (MASSACHUSETTS) FOR RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT - THE MASSACHUSETTS COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, JANE DOE INC. (JDI) WILL CONDUCT AN ASSESSMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION’S CAPACITY TO ENGAGE IN EQUITY-FOCUSED PREVENTION WORK. THE PURPOSE OF THIS ASSESSMENT IS TO INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF JDI’S CAPACITY TO ENGAGE IN EQUITY-FOCUSED PREVENTION WORK TO ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITY IN MASSACHUSETTS. ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE STAFF INTERVIEWS AND FOCUS, DOCUMENT REVIEWS, AND PARTNER INTERVIEWS AND SURVEYS. THE ASSESSMENT WILL RESULT IN A SERIES OF RECOMMENDATIONS TO INCREASE JDI’S CAPACITY TOWARD SPECIFIC FOCUS AREAS FOR HEALTH EQUITY WORK, INCLUSIVE OF JDI'S FRAMEWORK AT THE INTERSECTIONS OF GENDER BASED VIOLENCE AND RACIAL EQUITY.. THE ASSESSMENT WILL BE CONDUCTED USING A VARIETY OF METHODS, INCLUDING INTERVIEWS, FOCUS GROUPS, SURVEYS, AND DOCUMENT AND POLICY REVIEWS. THIS ASSESSMENT WILL ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING SIX OUTCOMES: 1) INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES; 2)  INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS; 3) INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY; 4) INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS; 5) INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF THE ORGANIZATIONAL AND PUBLIC POLICY AND SYSTEMS EFFORTS THAT FACILITATE OR HINDER IMPLEMENTATION OF HEALTH EQUITY-ORIENTED PREVENTION WORK; AND 6) INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF THE CULTURAL FACTORS AT THE ORGANIZATIONAL AND SYSTEMS LEVELS THAT FACILITATE OR HINDER IMPLEMENTATION OF HEALTH EQUITY-ORIENTED PREVENTION WORK.

VERMONT - ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY - PROJECT TITLE: RPE ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION APPLICANT NAME: VERMONT NETWORK AGAINST DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE (THE NETWORK) ADDRESS: P.O. BOX 405, MONTPELIER, VT 05601 CONTACT PHONE NUMBERS: VOICE 802-223-1302 EXT 1112; FAX 802-223-6943; CELL 802-793-4187 EMAIL ADDRESS: CHANI@VTNETWORK.ORG		WEBSITE ADDRESS: WWW.VTNETWORK.ORG  THE VERMONT NETWORK PLANS TO STRENGTHEN CAPACITY ACROSS OUR ORGANIZATION TO ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION STRATEGIES DESIGNED TO ACCOMPLISH VERMONT RPE STATE PLAN GOALS.  THESE ARE: INCREASING SAFETY, EQUITY AND RESPECT AND DECREASING SEXUAL HARM AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN THE LIVES OF VERMONT YOUTH AGED 12-18, ESPECIALLY YOUTH OF COLOR, LGBTQ YOUTH, YOUTH WITH DISABILITIES AND YOUTH LIVING IN POVERTY. THE VERMONT NETWORK WILL IMPLEMENT TWO STRATEGIES DURING THE ONE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD: 1.	CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF THE VERMONT NETWORK’S READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL HARM, AND 2.	DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS BASED ON THE ASSESSMENT FINDINGS, TO INCLUDE AND ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL HARM AND PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY IN FUTURE WORK PLANS WITHIN THE RPE GRANT PROGRAM AND ACROSS THE ORGANIZATION.  DURING THE ONE YEAR GRANT PERIOD THE VERMONT NETWORK PLANS TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES DELINEATED IN THE CDC’S PROJECT DESCRIPTION FOR THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY: INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF VERMONT NETWORK STAFF EXPERTISE IN HEALTH EQUITY AND PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE USING PUBLIC HEALTH MODEL, AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES INSIDE AND OUTSIDE THE ORGANIZATION TO ADVANCE THESE GOALS; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION STRATEGIES; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE OR ARE NOT MEETING CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS; AND INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF THE VERMONT NETWORK’S CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION TO RPE SUB-RECIPIENTS AND OTHER VERMONT NETWORK MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS AND STAKEHOLDERS, AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY. ADDITIONALLY, THE VERMONT NETWORK PLANS TO ACHIEVE THESE OUTCOMES: INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF WORK ALREADY IN PROGRESS ACROSS THE ORGANIZATION THAT CONTRIBUTES TO HEALTH EQUITY AND PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL HARM; INCREASED ALIGNMENT ACROSS THE ORGANIZATION IN SERVICE OF EQUITY-FOCUSED PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS; IDENTIFIED OPPORTUNITIES TO GROW PREVENTION EFFORTS; CREATED PATHWAYS FOR INCREASING YOUTH-FOCUSED, EQUITY-ORIENTED PREVENTION WORK; INCREASED CAPACITY FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION HEALTH EQUITY EFFORTS ACROSS THE LIFESPAN, BEYOND VERMONT RPE’S CURRENT FOCUS POPULATION. THE VERMONT NETWORK WILL WORK WITH A VARIETY OF PARTNERS WITH EXPERTISE IN PREVENTION OF SEXUAL HARM AND ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY IN PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTING THE CAPACITY ASSESSMENT, DEVELOPING RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION STEPS, CONDUCTING A PROCESS EVALUATION TO DETERMINE THE EXTENT TO WHICH THE VERMONT NETWORK HAS MET THE DELIVERABLES SOUGHT BY THE CDC, AND DEVELOPING PLANS TO EVALUATE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED IN RESPONSE TO THE RECOMMENDATIONS.

PREVENTION RESOURCES & OUTREACH ASSESSMENT (PROA) PROJECT - THE GUAM COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT & FAMILY VIOLENCE (GCASAFV) PROPOSES TO CHAMPION PRIMARY PREVENTION TO REDUCE THE PREVALENCE OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE ON GUAM THROUGH ITS PREVENTION RESOURCES & OUTREACH ASSESSMENT (PROA) PROJECT. 'PROA' IS ALSO THE TERM FOR THE  TRADITIONAL SAILING OUTRIGGER BOATS OF THE INDIGENOUS PEOPLE OF THE GUAM AND THE NORTHERN MARIANAS, THE CHAMORU. WITH THIS PROA PROJECT, GCASAFV WILL NAVIGATE THE ISLAND'S LARGELY ASIAN-PACIFIC ISLAND (API)COMMUNITY, ENGAGE GCASAFV'S MEMBER PROGRAMS, COMMUNITY PARTNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS, AND FACILITATE LISTENING SESSIONS WITH GCASAFV'S COMMUNITY ACTION (CA) TEAMS TO DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS AND ACTION PLAN TO ADVANCE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION ACTIVITIES AND FOSTER SAFE, HEALTHY, AND VIOLENCE-FREE COMMUNITIES. ALL TOO OFTEN THE COMMUNITY'S RESPONSE TO SEXUAL VIOLENCE IS REACTIONARY AND AND PREVENTION EFFORTS ARE SHORTCHANGED. GCASAFV IS COMMITTED TO ENHANCE ITS OWN RESOURCES THROUGH TRAINING AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND CA TEAMS, REPRESENTING TARGETED COMMUNITIES -- YOUTH AND FAMILIES, YOUNG ADULTS, ELDERLY, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, API, MEN, AND LGBTQ.

PUERTO RICO COALITION AGAINST DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT - SEXUAL VIOLENCE (SV) IS A SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM AS WELL AS A VIOLATION OF THE MOST BASIC HUMAN RIGHT. IN PUERTO RICO, THE BEHAVIORAL RISK FACTOR SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM (BRFSS) IDENTIFIES THAT THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE EXPERIENCE SEXUAL VIOLENCE VICTIMIZATION EACH YEAR. COORDINADORA PAZ PARA LAS MUJERES, INC. IS PRESENTING THIS PROPOSAL FOR PROMOTING UNDERSTANDING AND ASSESSING THE CAPACITY FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE. OUR ORGANIZATION IS THE CDC’S DESIGNATED DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT DUAL COALITION FOR THE TERRITORY OF PUERTO RICO AND IS ON THE POSITION TO IMPLEMENT THIS PROJECT. COLLABORATION WILL BE ESTABLISHED WITH A DIVERSITY OF SECTORS, AS SHOWN IN THE NARRATIVE AND ON THE COALITION’S MEMBERS AND PARTNERS ATTACHMENT. A SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT WILL BE DESIGNED, DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED IN A PARTICIPATORY METHODOLOGY, INCLUDING ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVE UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS AND A DIVERSITY OF SECTORS INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO UNIVERSITIES, GOVERNMENT, THE HEATH DEPARTMENT, AND REPRESENTATION OF THE 40-MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS THAT COMPOSE THE COALITION. SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH AND OTHER OBJECTIVES FROM HEALTHY PEOPLE 2023 WILL BE CONSIDERED IN THE DESIGN. THE PROJECT WILL BE CONDUCTED DURING A 12 MONTHS PERIOD, TWO EXPERIENCED FACILITATORS WILL LEAD THE PROCESS. THE RESULTS WILL BE SHARED AND DISCUSSED WITH THE PARTICIPANT ORGANIZATIONS AND USED AS PART OF THE COALITION’S WORK FOR ADVANCING PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN PUERTO RICO. AS A RESULT OF THIS CAPACITY ASSESSMENT THE COALITION WILL BE ABLE TO IDENTIFY: STAFF WITH EXPERTISE FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE, MAPPING PRACTICES AND PROJECTS, IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL LEADERS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDERS AND SUPPORTING THE DEVELOPMENT OF COMPETENCIES ON ALL OF THE ORGANIZATIONS, FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTHY PEOPLE 2023 OBJECTIVES IN A CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE MANNER FOR THE POPULATION OF PUERTO RICO A ND ITS LOCAL COMMUNITIES. QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE DATA WILL BE GATHERED AND ANALYZED, AND A PROCESS AND PRODUCT EVALUATION EXERCISE WILL BE PART OF THE DESIGN.

AMIOTONU MA LE AMIOTONU  SOIFUA MALOLOINA (HEALTH EQUITY) IDENTIFYING AMERICAN SAMOA'S ACCESSIBILITY TO CARE TO REACH EVERY CITIZENS FULL HEALTH POTENTIAL. - AMIOTONU MA LE AMIOTONU  SOIFUA MALOLOINA (HEALTH EQUITY) PROVIDES PEOPLE ACCESSIBILITY TO HEALTH CARE THAT THEY REQUIRE TO REACH THEIR FULL HEALTH POTENTIAL. IN AMERICAN SAMOA THE PATHWAY TO RECEIVE CARE IS DIFFICULT DUE TO EXCLUSION, OR DISADVANTAGES CREATED BY LEGISLATIVE POLICIES, HEALTH POLICIES, AND GROUP THINK DEBILITATING THE PROMOTION OF HEALTHY COMMUNITIES. THE AMERICAN SAMOA ALLIANCE AGAINST DOMESTIC & SEXUAL VIOLENCE, THE U.S. TERRITORY SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION MISSION IS TO EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES IN AMERICAN SAMOA THROUGH COLLABORATION, PROMOTING RESILIENCY, AND STRENGTHENING CAPACITY TO ELIMINATE DOMESTIC & SEXUAL VIOLENCE. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP US TO UNPACK HOW WE HOLD DISCUSSIONS TO PROMOTE  EQUITY, WHEN OUR CULTURAL SYSTEMS SUPPORT THE UNBALANCED REPRESENTATION OF MANY MAKING EQUITY DIFFICULT TO ACHIEVE. SAMOA ISLANDS ARE HOMOGENOUS COMMUNITIES, AS 91.6% OF POPULATION IN AMERICAN SAMOA ARE NATIVE SAMOAN (U.S. CENSUS 2010).  SAMOANS ARE ENTRENCHED IN THE FA’ASAMOA (SAMOAN WAY).  THE FA’AMATAI SYSTEM, A KEY SOCIO-POLITICAL SYSTEM OF GOVERNANCE ENSURES THE WELFARE OF THE FAMILY AND WELLBEING OF THE EXTENDED FAMILY, AND PROTECTION OF FAMILY PROPERTY.  MOST MATAI’S (CHIEFS) ARE MEN.  CURRENTLY, THE TERRITORIAL LEGISLATURES CONSIST OF ALL MEN.  THERE ARE NO WOMEN SENATORS OR HOUSE REPRESENTATIVES, COUPLED WITH THE FACT WOMEN SEXUAL VIOLENCE IS A MAJOR PUBLIC HEALTH AND SOCIAL PROBLEM IN THE SAMOAN ISLANDS. HEGEMONIC MASCULINITY HAS GRAVE IMPACT ON SOCIETY AND RAPE, AS IT HARMS SOCIAL EQUALITY AND HUMAN DEVELOPMENT.  POWER DISTRIBUTION AND SOCIAL DETERMINANTS ARE ROOT CAUSES OF HEALTH INEQUITIES. THE ALLIANCE PROPOSES TO ASSESS OUR ORGANIZATIONAL ABILITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION REGARDING RAPE.  THIS WILL REQUIRE DIFFICULT DISCUSSIONS, AS WE UNPACK OR IDENTIFY THE BARRIER TO GROWING EQUITY AND INCLUSION IN OUR COMMUNITY. WE ARE DEDICATED TO TAKING ACTION-ORIENTED STEPS TO CREATE SPACES THAT WILL ALLOW US TO DISCUSS, IDENTIFY ACTION PLANS, AND COMMIT TO MAKING CHANGES.  THIS WILL BE DONE BY USING PACIFIC WAYS, OR “TALANOA” (TALK) SESSIONS WITH ALLIANCE STAFF, AND VAEGA O PAAGA (COMMUNITY PARTNERS), EITHER INDIVIDUALLY, OR WITHIN A GROUP SETTING.  DISCUSSIONS WILL FOCUS ON POWER DISTRIBUTION, HISTORICAL ROOTS OF UNEQUAL POWER, IN THE FA’ASAMOA, AND FA’AMATAI SYSTEMS, CULTURAL SYSTEMS, THAT PROMOTE HEALTH INEQUITIES IN SAMOAN COMMUNITIES.  WE WILL ASSESS THE ALLIANCE’S ABILITY TO BECOME A DIVERSE TEAM. EVALUATING OUR CULTURAL PERSPECTIVES, AND HOW WE ARE CONTRIBUTING TO WORKING WITH DIFFERENT IDENTITIES AND GROWTH.

NC- CONNECTING SV PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY. NCCASA WILL CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF THE COALITION'S READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES. - HEALTH ACCESS AND INFORMATION SHOULD BE A BASIC HUMAN RIGHT FOR ALL. HOWEVER WE KNOW THAT IS NOT THE REALITY FOR MANY PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY PEOPLE FROM MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES. THE LONG TERM HEALTH NEEDS FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE SURVIVORS ARE NOT ADEQUATELY ASSESSED, ADDRESSED OR FULLY RESEARCH, RESULTING IN SURVIVORS NOT RECEIVING CRITICAL SERVICES AND SUPPORT FROM THOSE WHO PROVIDE MEDICAL CARE.  THE LACK OF  HEALTH ACCESS FOR SURVIVORS SPECIFICALLY THOSE FROM MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES CREATES FURTHER INEQUITIES IN THEIR ONGOING HEALTH CARE NEEDS. THIS IS NOT UNIQUE TO SURVIVORS AND THE CONNECTION TO FORM OF OPPRESSION DIRECTLY IMPACT HEALTH INEQUITIES THROUGHOUT SOCIETY.  THERE IS MUCH MORE TO BE DONE TO CREATE HEALTH EQUITY IN OUR COMMUNITIES AND THIS PROJECT WILL CONDUCT AN ASSESSMENT TO DETERMINE THOSE GAPS AND INFORM STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THESE INEQUITIES IN NC.  NCCASA WILL PARTNER WITH RESEARCH PARTNERS, COMMUNITY HEALTH PARTNERS AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS WHO ARE WORKING TO ADDRESS HEALTH EQUITY IN NC. TO ADDRESS THE CURRENT HEALTH INEQUITIES AND TO CREATE COMMUNITY BASED PROTECTIVE FACTORS WE MUST EXAMINE WHAT AND HOW THE COMMUNITIES MOST IMPACTED ARE ACTIVE PARTICIPANTS IN ADDRESSING THE OUTCOMES IDENTIFIED THROUGH THE ASSESSMENT. WHEN FUNDED THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO CREATE STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS TO ENHANCE ACCESS TO EQUITABLE HEALTH OUTCOMES.

TEXAS ASSOCIATION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT ASSESSMENT OF CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT AND SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF EFFECTIVE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS THAT ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY - THE TEXAS ASSOCIATION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (TAASA) WILL DEVELOP AND COMPLETE A COMPREHENSIVE ASSESSMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION’S CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT AND SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION THROUGH TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ABOUT EFFECTIVE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS FOCUSED ON ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY. THE ASSESSMENT WILL INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF AVAILABLE DATA AND GAPS IN TEXAS-SPECIFIC DATA RELATED TO POPULATIONS DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND HEALTH DISPARITIES, AND ASSESSMENT OF THE CAPACITY OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS. THE CAPACITY ASSESSMENT WILL BE DEVELOPED BY COMBINING FEEDBACK AND INFORMATION FROM ORGANIZATIONS WORKING WITH AND INDIVIDUALS FROM POPULATIONS DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND HEALTH DISPARITIES (INCLUDING YOUTH AND BLACK, INDIGENOUS, AND PEOPLE OF COLOR [BIPOC] COMMUNITIES), CURRENT PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS, TAASA STAFF, AND EXISTING EVIDENCE-BASED CAPACITY ASSESSMENTS. THE ASSESSMENT WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS AND IMPLEMENTATION ACTIONS THAT WILL INCREASE TAASA’S CAPACITY. KEY OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE: 1) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES; 2) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS; 3) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY NEEDS; 4) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY; AND 5) INCREASED TAASA PREVENTION STAFF CAPACITY TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING ON IMPLEMENTATION OF SV PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS THAT INCORPORATE HEALTH EQUITY, AND IMPLEMENT SV PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS THAT INCORPORATE HEALTH EQUITY.

CDC RPE MS COALITION PREVENTION CAPACITY - PURPOSE: MS COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (MSCASA) IS A STATEWIDE NON-PROFIT, NONGOVERNMENTAL SEXUAL VIOLENCE ADVOCACY AND PREVENTION ORGANIZATION REPRESENTING TEN LOCAL RAPE CRISIS CENTERS, FIVE BEING CDC-RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION FUNDED CENTERS (RPE CENTERS) TO IMPLEMENT PRIMARY PREVENTION USING THE SOCIAL ECOLOGICAL MODEL AT THE COMMUNITY LEVEL. MSCASA PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ADVOCATES, MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS, THE MS BAND OF CHOCTAW INDIANS, COLLEGE/UNIVERSITIES, SEXUAL VIOLENCE SURVIVORS, LAW ENFORCEMENT, MILITARY, CORRECTIONS, FAITH COMMUNITIES, AND OTHER ADVOCACY PROGRAMS IN MISSISSIPPI. MSCASA BUILDS UPON STRONG COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE GOALS OF STRENGTHENING SERVICES FOR VICTIMS OF SEXUAL ASSAULT, DATING VIOLENCE, AND STALKING AND PROMOTING COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTION STRATEGIES AROUND THE STATE. MSCASA PROVIDES ALL-INCLUSIVE, RESPONSIVE, AND WELL-INFORMED TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ENSURE SURVIVOR-CENTERED RESPONSES ARE HOLISTIC, WHILE HOLDING OFFENDERS ACCOUNTABLE. MSCASA WILL BUILD AND ENHANCE THE PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGY IMPLEMENTATION FOCUSED ON ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY. THIS 12-MONTH PERIOD REQUIRES MSCASA TO CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES, DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY, AND ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION. USE A DATA-DRIVEN APPROACH TO ADDRESS PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES WITH A HIGH BURDEN OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE (SV), ASSESS EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS TO DETERMINE GAPS, AND IDENTIFY COLLABORATIVES TO ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY AND ALIGN COALITION AND STATE RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION (RPE) PROGRAM PRIMARY PREVENTION EFFORTS. THIS FOCUS HELPS BUILD THE FOUNDATION FOR MSCASA TO ENHANCE, EXPAND, AND STRENGTHEN PRIMARY SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS, ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES, INCREASE THE USE OF DAT A TO INFORM PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS AND CREATE MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT WITH STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, STATE SEXUAL ASSAULT COALITION, CULTURALLY SPECIFIC ORGANIZATIONS, AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN THE RPE PROGRAM.  OUTCOMES: DURING THIS PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT PHASE, MSCASA WILL ENHANCE, EXPAND, AND STRENGTHEN PRIMARY PREVENTION OF SV EFFORTS; ADDRESS HEALTH EQUITIES; CREATE MEANINGFUL INVOLVEMENT AND ENGAGEMENT WITH LOCAL RAPE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION CENTERS (RPE CENTERS). BY THE END OF A 12-MONTH PERIOD, MSCASA WILL PERFORM A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF THE COALITION'S READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGIES AND DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY AND ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION. MSCASA WILL REDUCE THE BARRIERS AND LACK OF UNDERSTANDING THE LINK BETWEEN SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND HEALTH EQUITIES. MSCASA WILL WORK TO ACHIEVE THE SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES:  INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF STAFF EXPERTISE AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES; INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES USED TO IDENTIFY POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF FOCUS; INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS, AND HOW THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE/ARE NOT MEETING THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK NEEDS; AND INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVISION AND HOW WELL IT INCORPORATES HEALTH EQUITY. MSCASA WILL HIRE A DEDICATED PREVENTION COORDINATOR TO MANAGE THE DAY-TO-DAY ACTIVITIES TO ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY. 	MSCASA WILL SHARE RESOURCE TOOLS WITH 5 RPE CENTERS TO ASSESS THEIR ORGANIZATIONS TO DETERMINE CAPACITY OR NEEDED CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT PRIMARY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES. MSCASA WILL WORK WITH CDC NATIONAL TA PROVIDERS, MS STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH, AND UTILIZE EXISTING PUBLIC HEALTH RESOURCES FROM CDC, MSDH, OTHER IDENTIFIED PARTNERS DOING PUBLIC HEALTH AND HEALTH EQUITY WORK. THIS WILL HELP TO ENHANCE EFFORTS TO BUILD THE FOUNDATION FOR THE COALITION.

THE PREVENTION OF SV THROUGH A PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACH TO DECREASE RISK FACTORS AND INCREASE PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR SV PREVENTION THROUGH THE LENS OF A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT. - ACAR WORKS TO IMPROVE TREATMENT OF AND SERVICES TO SEXUAL ASSAULT VICTIMS, INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND TO IMPROVE INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF SEXUAL ASSAULT. EXPOSURE TO VIOLENCE IS GREATLY ASSOCIATED WITH COMMUNITIES WHO ARE PHYSICALLY, SOCIALLY, AND ECONOMICALLY DEPRIVED.     THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY BY IMPLEMENTING A DATA-DRIVEN APPROACH TO EXPAND OUR PREVENTION CAPACITY.  BUILDING ON OUR DECADES-LONG COLLABORATIONS WITH STAKEHOLDERS, INCLUDING ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND OUR STORIED HISTORY AS PREVENTION PROVIDERS, WE WILL DEVELOP AN ASSESSMENT THAT WILL ADDRESS THOSE DISPARITIES, ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITIES, AND PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY IN THOSE COMMUNITIES. THIS NOFO AFFORDS THE OPPORTUNITY FOR ACAR TO: -	CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT IN ORDER TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED SV PREVENTION STRATEGIES. -	DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY AND ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION. -	ENHANCE EXPERTISE IN PRIMARY PREVENTION AND HEALTH INEQUITIES. -	INCREASE USE OF DATA TO INFORM PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS. -	ESTABLISH PARTNERSHIPS THAT INCREASE THE COALITION’S ABILITY TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF POPULATIONS. -	IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR INDIVIDUALS, COMMUNITIES, AND COMMUNITIES IN THE POPULATION(S) AND COMMUNITIES OF GREATEST NEED MOST AFFECTED BY SV.

ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - FCASV WILL USE THIS FUNDING TO BUILD AND ENHANCE ITS PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY IN PREPARATION FOR IMPLEMENTING SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGIES FOCUSED ON ADVANCING HEALTH EQUITY. THE COALITION WILL CONDUCT A PRIMARY PREVENTION CAPACITY ASSESSMENT OF ITS READINESS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT EQUITY-FOCUSED STRATEGIES, DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY THAT ARE BASED UPON ASSESSMENT FINDINGS, AND ADVANCE FUTURE PRIMARY PREVENTION WORK

ASSESSING COALITION CAPACITY TO ADVANCE PRIMARY PREVENTION - THE SOUTH CAROLINA COALITION AGAINST DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT IS NAMED ON THE CDC APPROVED STATE COALITIONS LIST FOR 2023. THIS ABSTRACT IS PROVIDED IN RESPONSE TO FUNDING OPPORTUNITY CDC-RFA-CE-23-0006.  SOUTH CAROLINA HAS AMONG THE HIGHEST RATES OF SEXUAL AND INTIMATE PARTNER VIOLENCE IN THE NATION, CONSISTENTLY RANKING AS ONE OF THE MOST DANGEROUS STATES FOR WOMEN. THOSE LIVING IN RURAL AREAS ARE AT EVEN HIGHER RISK OF VICTIMIZATION. RURAL COMMUNITIES FURTHER FUNCTION AS A MULTIPLIER OF IMPACT FOR SUBGROUPS SUCH AS RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITY GROUPS, AND SEXUAL AND GENDER MINORITIES. NEARLY 50% (20 OF 46 COUNTIES) OF THE STATE IS CLASSIFIED AS RURAL/NON-METRO. THESE COUNTIES ARE HOME TO APPROXIMATELY 15% OF THE STATE’S POPULATION; MOST RESIDENTS LIVING IN POVERTY LIVE IN THESE RURAL/NON-METRO AREAS.     THESE COUNTIES SUFFER SIGNIFICANT LACK OF ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE; INTERVENTION AND PREVENTION SERVICES, AND SOCIAL STRUCTURES THAT SUPPORT AND REINFORCE RISK FACTORS FOR SEXUAL VIOLENCE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT (PROJECT PERIOD) IS TO ASSESS THE COALITION’S CAPACITY TO ADDRESS THE HEALTH DISPARITIES THAT LEAD TO SEXUAL VIOLENCE IN RURAL AREAS WITH A FOCUS ON SUBGROUPS SUCH AS RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITY GROUPS, AND SEXUAL AND GENDER MINORITIES. THIS ASSESSMENT WILL IDENTIFY INFORMATION, RESOURCES, AND TOOLS NEEDED TO REDUCE THE DISPARITIES IN THE 20 RURAL/NONMETRO COUNTIES OF SOUTH CAROLINA. THE INTENDED OUTCOMES OF THIS CAPACITY ASSESSMENT REFLECT THE COALITION’S INTENTION TO INCREASE ITS CAPACITY TO SERVE SOUTH CAROLINA’S AT-RISK RURAL COMMUNITY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED STAFF WORKFORCE, AND EXPERTISE IN WORKING WITH THIS POPULATION, INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF AVAILABLE DATA SOURCES REGARDING HEALTH SERVICES AND CULTURAL RISK FACTORS, INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT AND FUTURE COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO ADDRESS RURAL HEALTH DISPARITIES, AND INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT COALITION TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND EXISTING GAPS IN SERVICE.
