NC CORE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - NORTH CAROLINA (NC) IS THE 9TH MOST POPULOUS STATE IN THE NATION WITH OVER 10 MILLION RESIDENTS. INJURY AND VIOLENCE MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY AND THE RESULTING MEDICAL AND WORK LOSS COSTS TAKE A HUGE TOLL ON THE STATE?S ECONOMY. UNINTENTIONAL INJURIES ARE THE LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH FOR NORTH CAROLINIANS AGED 0-56 WHILE HOMICIDES AND SUICIDES ARE IN THE TOP 5 CAUSES OF DEATH FOR AGES 10-44. THERE WERE 8,487 INJURY-RELATED DEATHS IN NC IN 2019, INCLUDING 2,108 TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI)-RELATED DEATHS, 1,567 UNINTENTIONAL MOTOR VEHICLE TRAFFIC-RELATED DEATHS, AND 1,499 UNINTENTIONAL FALLS-RELATED DEATHS. UNINTENTIONAL FALLS WERE THE LEADING MECHANISM OF TBI DEATHS, HOSPITALIZATIONS, AND EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT (ED) VISITS AMONG NORTH CAROLINIANS 55 AND OLDER, WHILE MOTOR-VEHICLE CRASHES ARE THE 3RD LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH AND 2ND LEADING CAUSE OF HOSPITALIZATIONS AND ED VISITS AMONG ALL AGES. NORTH CAROLINA RANKED 32ND IN THE NATION FOR CHILDREN WITH 2+ ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES). HEALTHY NORTH CAROLINA 2030 CITES A BASELINE OF 23.6% (2016-17) WITH A TARGET OF 18.0% OF CHILDREN HAVING 2+ ACES. ON THE BEHAVIORAL RISK FACTOR SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM SURVEY IN 2014, 58.5% OF ADULTS REPORTED AT LEAST 1 ACE AND 22.8% EXPERIENCED 3-8 ACES.THE GOAL OF THE NC CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (SIPP) IS TO CONTINUE STRENGTHENING NC?S INJURY PREVENTION INFRASTRUCTURE BY BUILDING ON AND EXPANDING OUR INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERSHIPS; CONTINUING DATA-INFORMED DECISION MAKING VIA SURVEILLANCE, DATA ANALYSIS, AND PROGRAM EVALUATION; AND DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING SPECIFIC STRATEGIES TO PREVENT OR REDUCE THE INCIDENCE OF TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI), ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), AND TRANSPORTATION INJURIES. THE NORTH CAROLINA DIVISION OF PUBLIC HEALTH?S INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION BRANCH (NC DPH IVPB) HAS STAFF, EXPERTISE, CAPACITY AND A LEGACY OF PERFORMING COMPREHENSIVE SURVEILLANCE, DATA ANALYSIS AND TRANSLATION. WE ENGAGE A DIVERSE NETWOR K OF PARTNERS, LEVERAGE EVIDENCED-BASED AND EVIDENCE-INFORMED PRACTICES FOR INJURY PREVENTION, INFORM POLICY DEVELOPMENT, AND PROVIDE LEADERSHIP IN STATEWIDE INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS. IVPB BEGAN INCORPORATING A SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTOR (SRPF) FRAMEWORK TO OUR WORK OVER SIX YEARS AGO; WE COORDINATED A NATIONAL SYSTEMS THINKING APPROACHES AND BUILT THE CAPACITY OF LOCAL TEAMS TO USE SYSTEMS THINKING TO PREVENT ACES AND SUICIDES; AND CONTINUE TO APPLY A HEALTH EQUITY LENS TO DATA ANALYSIS, PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, PLANNING, AND IMPLEMENTING AND EVALUATING PROGRAMS. WE HAVE A HISTORY OF LEVERAGING COLLABORATIONS TO DEVELOP IVP TRAINING WITH A SRPF APPROACH FOR COMMUNITY TEAMS AND INJURY PREVENTION PRACTITIONERS ACROSS THE STATE AND REGION. WE WILL CONTINUE TO COLLECT AND ANALYZE DATA FROM ALL 100 COUNTIES ON BOTH FATAL AND NONFATAL INJURIES, INCLUDING THOSE RESULTING FROM FALLS, TBI, TRANSPORTATION, AND VIOLENCE, WHILE CONTINUING TO IDENTIFY DATA SOURCES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND ACES.

GEORGIA CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - THE GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH IS THE LEAD AGENCY CHARGED WITH PREVENTING DISEASE, INJURY, AND DISABILITY; PROMOTING HEALTH AND WELL-BEING; AND PREPARING FOR AND RESPONDING TO DISASTERS. THE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (DPH IPP) HAS A LONG-ESTABLISHED HISTORY OF COLLABORATION ACROSS AGENCY, INDUSTRY, AND SECTORS TO ADDRESS PREVENTABLE HARM TO ITS CITIZENS ACROSS GENDER, GEOGRAPHY, RACE, ETHNICITY, AND SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW GEORGIA TO LEVERAGE EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS TO ENGAGE IN ROBUST DATA AND SURVEILLANCE FOR TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, ACE PREVENTION, TBI PREVENTION, AND FALLS PREVENTION EFFORTS ACROSS THE LIFESPAN. LEVERAGING THE EXISTING STATE ACTION PLAN AND SURVEILLANCE EFFORTS AND USING A SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS (SRPF) APPROACH, DPH IPP WILL 1) UTILIZE ENHANCED SURVEILLANCE APPROACHES TO ESTIMATE AND MONITOR INJURIES STATEWIDE, 2) STRENGTHEN EXISTING COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS TO IMPLEMENT EVIDENCE-BASED PREVENTION STRATEGIES IN DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED POPULATIONS, AND 3) CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS AND ENHANCED EVALUATION ACTIVITIES CRITICAL TO ACCELERATE PROGRESS ON INJURY PREVENTION AND ASSURE CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. FOCUS AREA 1 - ACES: THE GEORGIA CORE SIPP TEAM WILL PARTNER WITH THE DPH PREVENTING ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES, DATA TO ACTION TEAM, TO ANALYZE ALBANY REGION-SPECIFIC ACE DATA, THEN PRODUCE ANNUAL COMMUNITY ACES AND RESILIENCE DATA REPORTS THAT INFORM COMMUNITY-LEVEL PARENTING SKILLS AND FAMILY RELATIONSHIP PROGRAMS IN THE ALBANY PUBLIC HEALTH DISTRICT.FOCUS AREA 2 ? TRANSPORTATION SAFETY: IN CLOSE PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CODES PROGRAM MANAGER AND THE CODES BOARD, THE GA CORE SIPP TEAM WILL CONDUCT A POLICY EVALUATION TO DETERMINE THE IMPACT OF GEORGIA?S SEAT BELT LAW (O.C.G.A. 40-8-76) ON TRANSPORTATION-RELATED INJURIES FOR CHILD PASSENGERS. SURVEILLANCE PRODUCTS WILL INCLUDE POLICY RECOMMENDATIONS, FACT SHEETS, AND OCCUPANT INJURY REPORTS FOR USE BY STAKEHOLDERS. IN ALIGNMENT  WITH THIS ANALYSIS, THE TEAM WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND THE UTILIZATION OF THE EVIDENCE-INFORMED CHILD PASSENGER SAFETY OBSERVATIONAL SURVEILLANCE TOOL DEVELOPED DURING THE CORE SVIPP 2016-2021 GRANT. FOCUS AREA 3 ? TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY: GEORGIA CORE SIPP WILL USE SURVEILLANCE ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY DIFFERENTIAL RATES OF TBI-RELATED MORBIDITY, MORTALITY, AND RISK FACTORS IN RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITY GROUPS, RURAL COMMUNITIES, AND PEOPLE WHO ARE MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED IN CENTRAL GEORGIA, TO BETTER TARGET PREVENTION EFFORTS IN THE NORTH CENTRAL GEORGIA REGION. SURVEILLANCE ACTIVITIES WILL INFORM THE DEVELOPMENT OF SPECIAL EMPHASIS REPORTS FOR DISSEMINATION TO COMMUNITY AND STATE-LEVEL TBI PARTNERS. FOCUS AREA 4 ? FALLS: GEORGIA CORE SIPP WILL ADDRESS FALLS PREVENTION WITHIN DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED COMMUNITIES IN NORTH CENTRAL GEORGIA AND THE VALDOSTA PUBLIC HEALTH DISTRICT. WE BELIEVE A COORDINATED FALL AND TBI PREVENTION EFFORT WITHIN THE SAME NORTH CENTRAL GEORGIA REGION WILL STRENGTHEN THE OUTCOMES FOR REDUCING THE RISK FACTORS AND INCREASING THE PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR FALLS PREVENTION, THROUGH A SRPF LENS. ENHANCED APPLICATION: GA CORE SIPP ENHANCED PROPOSAL WILL BE USED TO STRENGTHEN THE EVIDENCE BASE FOR INJURY PREVENTION THROUGH RIGOROUS EVALUATION AND INNOVATIVE SURVEILLANCE METHODS. IN PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE GOHS SHSP, THE CODES BOARD, IPRCE, AND VARIOUS INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERS, THE CORE SIPP TEAM WILL IMPROVE IMPLEMENTATION OF CDC?S TRANSPORTATION SAFETY APPROACH TO LINKING INFORMATION FOR NONFATAL CRASH SURVEILLANCE (LINCS).

THE COMMON CORE FOR MINNESOTA: SECURING SAFETY AND HEALTH WITH DATA TO ACTION THROUGH OUR STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM. - UNINTENTIONAL INJURIES KILLED MORE THAN 4,700 MINNESOTANS DURING 2016-2019 AND LED TO ABOUT 1.3 MILLION EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT AND HOSPITAL VISITS. MORE THAN 1,700 MINNESOTANS DIED IN TRAFFIC CRASHES DURING THE SAME 4-YEAR PERIOD, AND ALMOST 97,000 MINNESOTANS WERE TREATED FOR INJURIES DUE TO TRAFFIC CRASHES IN EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS AND HOSPITALS. MOST UNINTENTIONAL INJURIES ARE PREDICTABLE AND PREVENTABLE. THIS APPLICATION DESCRIBES THE CURRENT CAPACITY OF THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ITS INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION SECTION (IVPS). IT DETAILS THE HISTORY OF THE PROGRAM AND NOTES ITS SUCCESS IN BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS AND DATA SYSTEMS THAT ALLOW US TO FULLY EMBRACE AND PARTICIPATE IN TRUE DATA-TO-ACTION, IN PARTICULAR WITH HARD-TO-REACH POPULATION GROUPS.  THIS APPLICATION DETAILS HOW MDH IVPS PLANS TO STRENGTHEN THREE KEY AREAS: PREVENTING ACES, IMPROVING TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND SUPPORTING THE RESPONSE TO TBI-RELATED INJURIES. THE WORK PROPOSED FOLLOWS AN OUTLINE THAT MDH IVPS HAS USED TO SERVE MINNESOTANS FOR MANY YEARS: COLLECT DATA THROUGH EXCELLENT SURVEILLANCE TO LEARN THE PATTERNS OF HEALTH OUTCOMES; SHARE THESE DATA WITH RELEVANT ORGANIZATIONS, AGENCIES, AND PEOPLE; WORK TOGETHER TO MAKE EVIDENCE-BASED DECISIONS ABOUT ACTIONS TO ADDRESS THE FACTORS IMPACTING THE OUTCOMES; AND EVALUATE THE ACTIONS TO LEARN LESSONS FOR FUTURE PROGRAMMING. THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH KEY ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES, MDH IVPS AIMS TO DECREASE DISPARITIES IN ACES, TRANSPORTATION-RELATED INJURIES, AND TBI INCIDENCE BY EXPLORING SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS WHICH WILL, IN TURN, PREVENT A MULTITUDE OF OTHER INJURIES. NOTABLY, MDH IS APPLYING FOR THE ENHANCED OPPORTUNITY WITH A MULTI-METHOD, MULTI-COMPONENT EVALUATION OF THE IMPACT OF OUR NOVEL SURVEILLANCE STRATEGY USING THE MN SYNDROMIC SURVEILLANCE PIPELINE TO INFORM THE RESOURCE FACILITATION (RF) SERVICE THAT IS OFFERED TO PEOPLE LIVING WITH A TBI. FIRST, RF PARTICIPANTS? SHARED RISK AND PROTEC TIVE FACTORS (SRPFS) WILL BE EXPLORED TO IDENTIFY WHO IS USING THIS SERVICE TO INFORM IMPROVEMENT OF FUTURE RECRUITMENT STRATEGIES. SECOND, FOCUS POPULATIONS THAT EXPERIENCE TBIS AT A DISPROPORTIONATE RATE AND MAY BE PARTICULARLY DIFFICULT TO RECRUIT TO RF WITH ITS CURRENT RECRUITMENT METHODS WILL BE CONSULTED ON HOW TO BEST MEET THEIR NEEDS THROUGH RF. THIRD, PEOPLE WHO INITIALLY DID NOT PARTICIPATE IN RF UPON THE FIRST CONTACT ATTEMPT WILL BE RECONTACTED TO DETERMINE THE NEED FOR SUCH A RECONTACTING STRATEGY AND, IF FOUND TO BE NEEDED, DETERMINE THE MOST IMPACTFUL WAY TO RECONTACT PEOPLE WHO HAVE BEEN LIVING WITH A TBI FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF TIME. WE ANTICIPATE A NATIONAL AUDIENCE FOR THIS WORK. THE ADDITIONAL MOTIVATING IMPETUS BEHIND THIS APPLICATION IS THE DISSATISFACTION WITH THE STATUS QUO. WHILE MINNESOTA OVERALL ENJOYS GOOD HEALTH, THERE ARE POPULATION GROUPS (DEFINED BY GEOGRAPHY OR ZIP CODE, AGE GROUP, GENDER, INCOME AND RACE) THAT HAVE DISPROPORTIONATELY HIGH RATES OF ACES, MOTOR VEHICLE CRASH AND OTHER TRANSPORTATION-RELATED INJURY, AND TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY.AS A RESULT OF INVESTING IN MINNESOTA THROUGH THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY, INJURY PREVENTION AND CONTROL EFFORTS WILL BE ROOTED IN DATA, IMPLEMENTED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITIES AND FELLOW GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, FOCUSED ON POPULATIONS WHO EXPERIENCE INJURY INEQUITABLY, EVALUATED TO DISCOVER PROSPECTS FOR REPLICATION AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR IMPROVEMENT, AND RAISED AT POLICY-LEVEL MEETINGS TO SUPPORT THE GREATEST IMPACT. WITHOUT THIS FUNDING IN MINNESOTA, CORE INJURY PREVENTION INFRASTRUCTURE WILL BE COMPROMISED CERTAINLY AND CURTAILED TO A GREAT DEGREE. THIS HOPE FOR PREVENTION DRIVES THIS APPLICATION.

CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH BUREAU OF OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH AND INJURY PREVENTION (NYSDOH BOHIP) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR CONDUCTING ONGOING SURVEILLANCE AND DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING, AND EVALUATING INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAMS AND POLICIES LOCALLY AND STATEWIDE. AN INTEGRATED INFRASTRUCTURE THAT SUPPORTS A COORDINATED APPROACH TO REDUCING THE INCIDENCE, MORBIDITY, AND MORTALITY OF INJURY THROUGH SURVEILLANCE AND PREVENTION EFFORTS IS ESSENTIAL TO BUILD SUSTAINABILITY. THE NYS CORE SIPP WILL USE EXISTING DELIVERY SYSTEMS FOR DISSEMINATION, IMPLEMENTATION, AND EVALUATION OF BEST PRACTICE PROGRAMS AND POLICIES AS THEY RELATED TO THE THREE FOCUS AREAS: PREVENTION OF ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), TRANSPORTATION SAFETY AROUND MOTOR VEHICLE CRASHES (MVC), AND THE PREVENTION OF TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURIES (TBI).THE OVERARCHING OUTCOMES OF REDUCING NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES RELATED TO ACES, MVC (TRANSPORTATION SAFETY) AND TBI IN NYS REQUIRE MULTIPLE STATEWIDE ACTIONS, INCLUDING INTENSIVE EFFORTS TO TARGET DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED POPULATIONS, WHICH POSE SIGNIFICANT CHALLENGES. BOHIP WILL UTILIZE SURVEILLANCE AND OTHER SOURCES OF INFORMATION AND CDC IDENTIFIED EVIDENCE BASED STRATEGIES TO ASSIST IN REDUCING THE BURDEN AND IMPACT OF ALL THREE INJURY TYPES. BOHIP WILL FOLLOW A COLLABORATION BASED PUBLIC HEALTH MODEL FOR PREVENTING INJURY, FOCUSING PRIMARILY ON THE SURVEILLANCE, EDUCATION AND EVALUATION COMPONENTS AND UTILIZING STRATEGIES THAT FOCUS ON POSITIVE CHANGE IN INDIVIDUAL BEHAVIORS, AS WELL AS INFLUENCING PUBLIC POLICY THROUGH EPIDEMIOLOGY AND EVALUATION. THE MODEL?S STEPS WILL INCLUDE: 1) DEFINING PROBLEMS THROUGH SURVEILLANCE; 2) COLLECTING IN DEPTH DATA TO IDENTIFY RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS ASSOCIATED WITH HIGH RISK POPULATIONS AND STUDYING THE EFFECTS OF EVIDENCE BASED OR EVIDENCE INFORMED INTERVENTION STRATEGIES; 3) IDENTIFYING EXISTING OR DEVELOPING NEW INJURY PREVENTION PRODUCTS; 4) DISSEMINATING THE PRODUCTS, PARTICULARLY TO HIG H RISK POPULATIONS; 5) PROMOTING WIDE SPREAD IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PRODUCTS; AND 6) EVALUATING AND MONITORING THE IMPACT OF INJURY PREVENTION PRODUCTS. BOHIP WILL USE THIS APPROACH WITH FOCUSED EFFORTS ON DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED POPULATIONS PARTICULARLY CHILDREN AGE 0-19 ADULTS AFFECTED BY ACES, AND MV DRIVERS, AND SUBPOPULATIONS (E.G. RACIAL/ETHNIC MINORITIES) WHO EXPERIENCE HIGH LEVELS OF HEALTH DISPARITIES.

RHODE ISLAND CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH VIOLENCE AND INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (RIDOH VIPP) WILL IMPLEMENT A DATA-DRIVEN MULTI-SECTOR APPROACH TO ADDRESS INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION. AREAS OF FOCUS ARE ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI). VIPP WILL UTILIZE ITS EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS TO 1) INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF INJURY BURDEN AND RELATED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS USING NATIONAL, STATEWIDE, AND COMMUNITY-LEVEL DATA, 2) DEVELOP EVIDENCE-BASED STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS PRIORITY AREAS AND SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS, 3) DISSEMINATE NEW AND EMERGING DATA TO INFORM PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONS, AND 4) PRIORITIZE DISPROPORTIONALLY AFFECTED POPULATIONS, 5) IMPROVING DATA QUALITY THROUGH CONTINUED QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, AND 6) INCREASING ACCESS TO TIMELY DATA ON NONFATAL INJURY AND VIOLENCE OUTCOMES. THE PROJECT WILL ENHANCE AND IMPROVE THE TIMELINESS OF INJURY AND VIOLENCE DATA COLLECTION AND INFORM RECOMMENDATIONS FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION. RIDOH WILL USE ROBUST DATA AND SYNDROMIC SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS TO RAPIDLY RESPOND TO THE VARIOUS INJURY AND VIOLENCE EMERGING TRENDS IN COLLABORATION WITH KEY PARTNERS AND WILL REGULARLY EVALUATE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE THE EVIDENCE BASE FOR INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION ACTIVITIES. IN THE NEXT 5-YEAR FUNDING CYCLE, RIDOH?S VIPP STAFF AND EXTERNAL PARTNERS WILL BE ABLE TO MOBILIZE RESOURCES TO RESPOND TO OUTBREAKS, CLUSTERS, AND EMERGING INJURY THREATS AT THE LOCAL LEVEL AND AMONG DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED POPULATIONS.

THE MASSACHUSETTS CORE VIOLENCE AND INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MDPH) BASE SIPP PROJECT (BASE PROJECT) WILL EXPLORE AND ADDRESS ROOT CAUSES OF TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI), MOTOR VEHICLE CRASHES, AND OLDER ADULT FALLS BY APPLYING A SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH AND ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES LENS AS WE CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS, SHARE WITH AND GLEAN DATA FROM PARTNERS, IMPLEMENT COLLABORATIVE PROGRAMS, AND EVALUATE OUTCOMES. ACROSS ALL FOUR AREAS, PROPOSED ACTIVITIES WILL LEVERAGE ESTABLISHED MDPH STRATEGIC INITIATIVES IN POLICY ANALYSIS, TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, COMMUNICATIONS, AND SURVEILLANCE. BASE PROJECT STAFF WILL HARNESS NEW AND EXISTING DATASETS TO ESTABLISH BASELINE INDICATORS FOR PRIORITY AREAS; DEVELOP AND DELIVER EFFECTIVE TRAINING, EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO EXISTING STAKEHOLDERS AND PARTNERS WHO ARE NEW TO THE INJURY PREVENTION SPACE; AND MONITOR AND ANALYZE PROPOSED STATE POLICIES, INFORMING MDPH LEADERSHIP AND POLICYMAKERS OF THE BEST AVAILABLE EVIDENCE AND POTENTIAL UNINTENDED CONSEQUENCES OF PROSPECTIVE LEGISLATION. THROUGHOUT THIS PROJECT, MDPH WILL USE INTERNAL PROCESSES TO ENSURE THAT ACTIVITIES ARE IMPLEMENTED EQUITABLY, THAT MATERIALS ARE ACCESSIBLE TO UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, THAT EFFORTS ARE UNDERPINNED BY THE BEST AVAILABLE SURVEILLANCE DATA, AND THAT INITIATIVES ARE STRENGTHENED THROUGH CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. AS A RESULT OF THE BASE PROJECT ACTIVITIES, MDPH WILL INCREASE THE USE OF SURVEILLANCE DATA TO DEVELOP INJURY PREVENTION STRATEGIES, CREATE A DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF THE POPULATIONS FACING INJURY RISKS AND THE FACTORS DRIVING THOSE RISKS, AND, ULTIMATELY, DECREASE INJURY-RELATED MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY AMONG DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED POPULATIONS AND STATEWIDE. EFFORTS UNDER THE BASE PROJECT AROUND MOTOR VEHICLE CRASHES AND TBI WILL BE REINFORCED BY MDPH WORK IN ITS ENHANCED PROJECT, WHICH WILL HARNESS NOVEL, LINKED SURVEILLANCE DATA TO INFORM A HOST OF COORDINATED, REFLECTIVE IMPLEMENTATIO N AND EVALUATION EFFORTS AND BUILD THE EVIDENCE BASE FOR FUTURE INTERVENTIONS. MDPH HAS SUCCESSFULLY LINKED A SUBSET OF STATE-LEVEL TRAFFIC SAFETY DATASETS AND IS IN THE PROCESS OF LINKING ADDITIONAL DATA SOURCES. THIS UNIQUE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM OFFERS AN OPPORTUNITY TO CONDUCT IN-DEPTH ANALYSIS OF MULTIPLE RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS RELATED TO MOTOR VEHICLE (MV) CRASHES IN DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED POPULATIONS. SUCH ANALYSES WILL ALLOW US TO IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE DRIVER, NON-MOTORIST, CRASH, AND ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO MV CRASH INJURIES, WHICH CAN BE USED TO GUIDE PREVENTION STRATEGIES. BY PAIRING THE LINKED DATA INITIATIVE WITH QUALITATIVE FORMATIVE EVALUATION METHODS, THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS CRITICAL DATA GAPS; GENERATE A DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF THE RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS AND NEEDS AND ASSETS OF DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED POPULATIONS; AND FURTHER GUIDE THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION SAFETY-RELATED OUTCOMES FOR THOSE POPULATIONS. FINALLY, THE NOVEL DATA WILL SUPPORT THE OUTCOMES ASSESSMENT FOR NEW AND EXISTING TRANSPORTATION SAFETY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES AND UNDERPIN THE ANALYSIS OF PROPOSED POLICIES AND PROGRAMS IN THIS AREA. THROUGH THESE IMPLEMENTATION AND EVALUATION ACTIVITIES, THE ENHANCED PROJECT AIMS TO DECREASE RISK AND INCREASE PROTECTIVE FACTORS ASSOCIATED WITH TRANSPORTATION SAFETY AND TBI AMONG DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED POPULATIONS AND REDUCE CRASH-RELATED INJURY MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY, ESPECIALLY RELATED TO TBI.

CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM MONTANA (CORE SIPP MT) - THROUGH THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY, THE MONTANA INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM OF MONTANA DPHHS WILL REDUCE THE BURDEN OF THE STATED INJURY MECHANISMS THROUGH INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND UTILIZATION OF EMERGING DATA SOURCES AND INCREASED INTEGRATION WITH MULTI-SECTORAL PARTNERS TO ENACT EVIDENCE-BASED, SUSTAINABLE PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONS. WE WILL CONDUCT ASSESSMENT TO ENSURE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS AROUND INJURY FOR OUR DISPROPORTIONALLY AFFECTED COMMUNITIES AND ENSURE APPROPRIATE QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PRACTICES ARE IN PLACE TO ASSESS OUR ONGOING PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONS FOR INJURY PREVENTION.THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:-INCREASING CAPACITY AROUND INJURY PREVENTION DATA AND SURVEILLANCE TO BETTER UNDERSTAND DISPROPORTIONALLY AFFECTED POPULATIONS AND SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS AROUND ACES, TBIS, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY AND FIREARM SUICIDE. -EXPANDING ON EXISTING COLLABORATIONS AND ESTABLISHING NEW PARTNERSHIPS WITH MULTI-SECTORAL STAKEHOLDER GROUPS TO PRESENT THE DATA AND SURVEILLANCE AND CREATE PLANS FOR EVIDENCE-BASED PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION AROUND THE INJURY MECHANISM AREAS. -CONDUCT ONGOING EVALUATION AND ASSESSMENT OF STRATEGIES TO ENSURE EFFECTIVENESS AND UTILIZE TOOLKITS PUT OUT BY THE CDC AND OTHERS TO MAXIMIZE THE BENEFIT TO OUR STATE.IN THE SHORT-TERM, THROUGH THIS FUNDING WE ARE HOPING TO ACCOMPLISH INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND UTILIZATION OF EMERGING DATA SOURCES, ADOPTION OF BEST PRACTICES OF SURVEILLANCE AND ROBUST DATA/SURVEILLANCE, AND INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF INJURY AMONG DISPROPORTIONALLY AFFECTED POPULATIONS.  WE WILL INCREASE STAKEHOLDER INCLUSION AMONG MULTI-SECTORAL PARTNERS WITH SHARED COMMITMENT TO INJURY PREVENTION.  WE WILL ALSO HAVE A BETTER STATE-WIDE UNDERSTANDING OF SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS ACROSS INJURY PREVENTION AND EVIDENCE-INFORMED STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THESE NEEDS.  IN THE LONG-TERM, WE WILL REDUCE INJURY MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY, REDUCE RISK FACTORS, AND INCREASE IDENTIFI ED PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR THE STATED INJURY MECHANISMS.

SOUTH CAROLINA CORE SIPP - UNINTENTIONAL INJURIES WERE THE FIFTH LEADING CAUSE OF HOSPITALIZATION AND THE THIRD LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH IN SOUTH CAROLINA (SC), RESULTING IN 75,087 YEARS OF POTENTIAL LIFE LOST IN 2016. IN A REVIEW OF NATIONAL DATA, SOUTH CAROLINIANS HAVE HIGHER INJURY RATES IN NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY (NOFO) INJURY PRIORITY AREAS, ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), TRANSPORTATION SAFETY (TS) AND TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI),  THAN THOSE SEEN NATIONALLY. THIRTY TWO PERCENT OF SC ADULTS REPORTED HAVING FOUR OR MORE ACES, WHICH IS HIGHER THAN 17% REPORTED NATIONALLY. PREVENTING ACES COULD REDUCE MANY HEALTH CONDITIONS IN SC RESIDENTS INCLUDING HEART DISEASE, DEPRESSION, AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS. MOTOR VEHICLE CRASHES (MVC) ARE THE MOST COMMON CAUSE OF INJURY-RELATED DEATH IN SC. IN 2019, SC LED THE NATION IN DEATHS PER 100 MILLION MILES TRAVELLED (MMT) WITH 1.73 DEATHS PER 100 MMT COMPARED TO 1.11 DEATHS MMT NATIONALLY. IN 2019, SC HAD A TOTAL OF 1,409 TBI-RELATED INJURY FATALITIES AND AN AGE ADJUSTED RATE OF 26.0 PER 100,000 POPULATION, 50% HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL RATE AT OF 16.9 PER 100,000 POPULATION. THESE INJURIES CREATE A LARGE ECONOMIC BURDEN IN SC. BETWEEN 2016 AND 2019, INJURY-RELATED INCIDENTS COST SC EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS A TOTAL OF $6,948,015,065.  THROUGH THE CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (SIPP) FUNDING OPPORTUNITY, THE SC DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (DHEC) WILL BUILD UPON CURRENT PARTNERSHIPS TO IDENTIFY AND RESPOND TO EXISTING AND EMERGING INJURY THREATS WITH DATA-DRIVEN PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION. THE DHEC DIVISION OF INJURY AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION (DISAP) WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE BUREAU OF POPULATION HEALTH DATA ANALYTICS AND INFORMATICS (PHDAI) AND OTHER MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS TO ENGAGE IN ROBUST DATA AND SURVEILLANCE FOR ACES, TS, AND TBI. SPECIFICALLY, DISAP AND PHDAI WILL IDENTIFY DATA SOURCES, COLLECT BASELINE MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY DATA, LINK HOSPITALIZATION AND EMERGENCY ROOM DATA WITH MVC DATA,  STUDY LINKS BETWEEN INJURY AND VIOLENT DEATHS WITH THE SC VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (SCVDRS), ANALYZE SC YOUTH RISK BEHAVIORAL SURVEILLANCE SURVEY (YRBSS) AND BEHAVIORAL RISK FACTOR SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM (BRFSS) RESULTS, HOLD DATA WALKS, CREATE A DATA DISSEMINATION, USE AND IMPACT REPORT AND A PUBLIC FACING INJURY DASHBOARD. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL INFORM PREVENTION EFFORTS IN INJURY PRIORITY AREAS, DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED POPULATIONS, AND EMERGING INJURY TRENDS. THROUGH CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION, DISAP WILL WORK WITH EXISTING PARTNERS TO DRIVE PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION AND ACHIEVE IMPACT. PARTNERS INCLUDE THE OVERDOSE DATA-TO-ACTION TEAM, SC OFFICE OF RURAL HEALTH, REVENUE AND FISCAL AFFAIRS, DHEC VITAL STATISTICS, SCVDRS ADVISORY COUNCIL, THE ALLIANCE FOR A HEALTHIER SOUTH CAROLINA, CHILD WELL BEING COALITION, TRAFFIC RECORDING COORDINATION COMMITTEE, BRAIN INJURY LEADERSHIP COUNCIL, NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP, AND THE SC EPIDEMIOLOGICAL OUTCOMES WORKGROUP. OUR PARTNERS ALL HAVE A SHARED COMMITMENT TO INJURY PREVENTION AND WILL PARTICIPATE IN IDENTIFYING DATA SOURCES, DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS, PROGRAM PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION AND EVALUATION. DISAP WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH PARTNERS TO IMPLEMENT DATA-DRIVEN, EVIDENCE-BASED, HIGH-IMPACT, SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTOR APPROACHES. OVERALL GOALS OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE: TO REDUCE AND SUSTAIN INJURY MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY ASSOCIATED WITH ACES, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TBI; TO REDUCE AND SUSTAIN RISK FACTORS FOR ACES, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TBI; AND TO INCREASE AND SUSTAIN PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR ACES, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TBI.

CORE STATEWIDE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (SIPP) - ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), TRANSPORTATION-RELATED INJURIES, AND TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURIES (TBI) ARE ALL MAJOR CONTRIBUTORS TO MORTALITY, MORBIDITY, AND REDUCED QUALITY OF LIFE AMONG CALIFORNIANS. ACES ARE TRAUMATIC EVENTS, INCLUDING CHILD MALTREATMENT AND FAMILY DYSFUNCTION, OCCURRING BEFORE AGE 18. EXPERIENCING FOUR OR MORE ACES IS ASSOCIATED WITH SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASED RISK FOR SEVERAL LEADING CAUSES OF DEATH IN ADULTHOOD. RECENT SURVEY DATA SHOW THAT MORE THAN 62% OF CALIFORNIAN ADULTS EXPERIENCED AT LEAST ONE ACE BEFORE AGE 18, AND 16% EXPERIENCED FOUR OR MORE ACES. TRANSPORTATION INJURIES ARE THE SECOND LEADING CAUSE OF UNINTENTIONAL INJURY DEATHS IN CALIFORNIA. IN 2019, 3,888 CALIFORNIANS DIED AND 26,148 WERE HOSPITALIZED DUE TO MOTOR VEHICLE COLLISIONS. IN 2019, TBI CONTRIBUTED TO 5,078 INJURY DEATHS AND ANOTHER 34,065 CALIFORNIANS WERE HOSPITALIZED WITH INJURIES THAT RESULTED IN A TBI DIAGNOSIS. RATES OF INJURY-RELATED TBI DEATHS, HOSPITALIZATIONS, AND EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT (ED) VISITS INCREASE SHARPLY AFTER AGE 65 AND OLDER AGE IS KNOWN TO NEGATIVELY INFLUENCE OUTCOMES AFTER TBI.THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION BRANCH (CDPH-IVPB) TAKES A PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACH TO PREVENTING ACES, TRANSPORTATION INJURIES, AND TBI. THIS INCLUDES DEFINING AND MONITORING THE PROBLEM, IDENTIFYING RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS, COLLABORATING WITH RELEVANT STAKEHOLDERS, DEVELOPING AND TESTING PREVENTION STRATEGIES, AND ASSURING WIDESPREAD ADOPTION OF EFFECTIVE STRATEGIES.THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO EXPAND CDPH-IVPB?S EXISTING CAPACITY TO PREVENT ACES, TRANSPORTATION INJURIES, AND TBI AMONG AT-RISK POPULATIONS. ACE?S PREVENTION WILL TARGET CALIFORNIA?S MEDICAID (MEDI-CAL) BENEFICIARIES, WHO ARE MORE THAN 1.3 TIMES AS LIKELY TO REPORT FOUR OR MORE ACES COMPARED TO THOSE WITH PRIVATE OR EMPLOYER-BASED INSURANCE. TRANSPORTATION SAFETY WILL TARGET YOUNG ADULTS AGED 15-24, AN AGE RANGE THAT INCLUDES THOSE WI TH THE HIGHEST TRANSPORTATION INJURY RATE PER POPULATION (AGES 20-24) AS WELL AS PER MILE TRAVELED (AGES 15-19). TBI PREVENTION WILL FOCUS ON ADDRESSING THE PRIMARY CAUSES OF OLDER ADULT TBI, E.G., UNINTENTIONAL FALLS AND TRAFFIC-RELATED INJURIES. AMONG THOSE AGED 65 AND OLDER, FALLS ACCOUNT FOR MORE THAN 80% OF NON-FATAL HOSPITALIZATIONS AND ED VISITS WITH A TBI DIAGNOSIS.FOR EACH INJURY TOPIC AND TARGET POPULATION, CDPH-IVPB WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT TWO MUTUALLY REINFORCING STRATEGIC PLANS: A SURVEILLANCE/DATA STRATEGIC PLAN AND A STRATEGIC COLLABORATION/PARTNERSHIP PLAN. THE SURVEILLANCE/DATA STRATEGIC PLAN WILL IDENTIFY A PROCESS FOR CREATING INSIGHTFUL AND ACTIONABLE DATA PRODUCTS AND ENSURING THE DATA PRODUCTS REACH RELEVANT AUDIENCES. THE COLLABORATION/PARTNERSHIP STRATEGIC PLAN WILL BE INFORMED BY AN ASSET MAPPING EXERCISE AND FEATURE LEVEL SETTING WEBINARS TO FOSTER MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT. BOTH PLANS WILL BE DEVELOPED WITH EXTENSIVE INPUT FROM EXISTING PARTNERS AND STAKEHOLDERS AND BE DIRECTED TOWARD DEVELOPMENT OF A BASIC COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT GUIDE THAT WILL HELP USERS IDENTIFY COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS THROUGH AN EQUITY LENS, WHICH THEN WOULD INFORM APPROPRIATE EVIDENCE-BASED ACTIONS FOR INJURY PREVENTION. THROUGH THESE STRATEGIC PLANNING PROCESSES, CDPH-IVPB WILL STRENGTHEN ITS CAPACITY TO HELP AT-RISK COMMUNITIES INCREASE PROTECTIVE FACTORS AND REDUCE RISK FACTORS FOR ACES, TRANSPORTATION INJURIES, AND TBI. THESE EFFORTS ARE ULTIMATELY INTENDED TO RESULT IN A SUSTAINED REDUCTION OF INJURY MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY ASSOCIATED WITH ACES, TRANSPORTATION INJURY, AND TBI IN CALIFORNIA.

MARYLAND STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (THE DEPARTMENT) IS APPLYING FOR THE CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (CDC-RFA-CE21-2101) COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ISSUED BY THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC), NATIONAL CENTER FOR INJURY PREVENTION AND CONTROL (NCIPC). THE MARYLAND STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (THE PROGRAM) WILL ADDRESS INJURY THROUGH THE LENS OF SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS RELATED TO THE PRIORITY AREAS OF ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI), AND TRANSPORTATION-RELATED INJURY PREVENTION. THE PROGRAM WILL IMPLEMENT THREE STRATEGIES FOR THE PRIORITY FOCUS AREAS: ENGAGE IN ROBUST DATA/SURVEILLANCE TO INFORM THE BURDEN OF INJURY IN THE STATE, STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION, AND CONDUCT ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION FOR USE IN DECISION-MAKING.THE PROGRAM WILL EXPAND ITS EFFORTS TO UTILIZE CURRENT SURVEILLANCE SOURCES, SUCH AS MORTALITY, EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT, AND HOSPITALIZATION DATA. IN ADDITION, THE BETTER UNDERSTAND THE STATE'S BURDEN. THE DEPARTMENT WILL ENHANCE DATA WITH THE MARYLAND YOUTH RISK BEHAVIOR SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM (YRBS) AND THE MARYLAND BEHAVIORAL RISK FACTOR SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM (BRFSS). THE DEPARTMENT WILL IMPROVE DATA DISPLAYS AND DISSEMINATION WITH THE ENVIRONMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH TRACKING (EPHT) SYSTEM TO EXPLORE PROTECTIVE FACTORS AND RISK BEHAVIORS AND TRENDS IN RISK BEHAVIOR AND HEALTH OUTCOMES. THE PROGRAM'S APPROACH WILL BETTER IDENTIFY AND DESCRIBE THE DISPROPORTIONATE IMPACT OF INJURIES IN THE STATE.THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO GROW AND SUSTAIN PARTNERSHIPS FOR ADDRESSING THE PRIORITY AREAS, ACES, TBI, AND TRANSPORTATION SAFETY. THE PROGRAM WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE DEPARTMENT'S MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH BUREAU (MCH), BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (BHA), AND THE NCIPC-FUNDED PROGRAMS, INCLUDING THE MARYLAND VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (MVDRS), THE RAPE PREVENTION EDUCATION (RPE), AND THE OVERDOSE DATA TO ACTIO N IN THE STATE TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS. THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO WORK WITH EXTERNAL PARTNERS, INCLUDING THE PARTNERSHIP FOR A SAFER MARYLAND (THE INJURY COMMUNITY IMPLEMENTATION GROUP, ICIG), THE BRAIN INJURY ASSOCIATION OF MARYLAND, THE MARYLAND FALLS FREE COALITION, MEDCHI (THE STATE MEDICAL SOCIETY), AND THE MARYLAND HIGHWAY SAFETY OFFICE (MHSO) AMONG OTHERS. THESE PARTNERS WILL EDUCATE LEADERS AND DECISION-MAKERS, PARTICIPATE IN STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, AND DISSEMINATE DATA AND BEST PRACTICES.THE PROGRAM WILL WORK WITH THE JOHNS HOPKINS CENTER FOR INJURY RESEARCH AND POLICY (CDC-FUNDED INJURY CONTROL RESEARCH CENTERS (ICRCS)) TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION STRATEGIES FOR THE INJURY PREVENTION OBJECTIVES AND ACTIVITIES. SPECIFIC INITIATIVES TO ADDRESS THE FOCUS AREAS INCLUDE BUILDING UPON THE DEPARTMENT'S PARTICIPATION IN A STATE-LEVEL LEARNING COLLABORATIVE ON PREVENTING ACES, PARTNERING WITH THE MHSO ON STRATEGIES TO MITIGATE DISTRACTED AND IMPAIRED DRIVING-RELATED TRANSPORTATION INJURIES, AND COLLABORATING WITH HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS IN MARYLAND TO ASSESS THE USE OF THE PEDIATRIC MILD TBI GUIDELINES TO IDENTIFY BARRIERS TO IMPLEMENTATION. IN SUMMARY, THE PROGRAM AIMS TO INFORM PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION AND SUSTAIN ADVANCEMENT AND IMPROVEMENT IN INJURY PREVENTION PRACTICES AND OUTCOMES TO REDUCE INJURY-RELATED MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

COLORADO CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (SIPP) - THE OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE COLORADO CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (SIPP) BASE COMPONENT IS TO STRENGTHEN COLORADO?S INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAMS AND POLICIES THROUGH ENHANCED DATA AND SURVEILLANCE, STRENGTHENED STRATEGIC COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS, AND ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION. IN DOING SO, COLORADO AIMS TO DEMONSTRATE IMPACT TO REDUCE AND SUSTAIN INJURY MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY ASSOCIATED WITH ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI) AS WELL AS REDUCE RISK FACTORS AND INCREASE PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR THESE PRIORITY AREAS.THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT?S (CDPHE) VIOLENCE AND INJURY PREVENTION-MENTAL HEALTH PROMOTION (VIP-MHP) BRANCH WILL IMPLEMENT AND EVALUATE THREE OVERARCHING STRATEGIES TO ACCOMPLISH OVERALL OUTCOMES OF THE CORE SIPP BASE COMPONENT:STRATEGY 1: ENGAGE IN ROBUST DATA/SURVEILLANCE FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONSTRATEGY 2: STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONSTRATEGY 3: CONDUCT ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONIN ADDITION, COLORADO WILL IMPLEMENT THE CORE SIPP IMPLEMENTATION AND ENHANCED EVALUATION (ENHANCED) COMPONENT TO INCREASE IMPLEMENTATION OF PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONS TO PREVENT INJURIES IN COLORADO?S DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED COMMUNITIES. SPECIFICALLY, CDPHE PLANS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT TO THE CITY OF DENVER, WHICH IS IMPLEMENTING EVIDENCE-BASED BUILT ENVIRONMENT POLICIES THAT STRENGTHEN ECONOMIC RESILIENCE AND CONDUCT A ROBUST EVALUATION TO MEASURE THE IMPACT ON INCREASING PROTECTIVE FACTORS THAT PREVENT ACES AND INCREASE TRANSPORTATION SAFETY. BUILD ENVIRONMENT POLICIES THAT STRENGTHEN ECONOMIC RESILIENCE WILL FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING PROTECTIVE FACTORS: FOOD SECURITY, HOUSING ACCESS, AND TRANSPORTATION SAFETY. IN ADDITION, CDPHE WILL CONDUCT NOVEL SURVEILLANCE TO BUILD CAPACITY IN DATA SCIENCE USING A NEW MOTOR VEHICLE CRASH DATA SYSTEM FOR SURVEILLANCE OF LOCAL OUTC OMES AND FOR EVALUATION OF THE LONG-TERM IMPACT OF BUILT ENVIRONMENT POLICIES.

CORE STATE VIOLENCE AND INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (CORE SVIPP) - PURPOSETHE PURPOSE OF THE BASE FUNDING IS TO DECREASE INJURY RELATED MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY AND INCREASE SUSTAINABILITY OF INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAMS AND PRACTICES IN TENNESSEE.   IN ADDITION, THE ENHANCED COMPONENT ACTIVITIES WILL STRENGTHEN THE EVIDENCE-BASE FOR INJURY PREVENTION THROUGH SUSTAINED ADVANCEMENT AND IMPROVEMENT IN INJURY PREVENTION PRACTICES AND OUTCOMES.  THE BASE PROPOSAL ACCOMPLISHES THOSE GOALS THROUGH UTILIZATION OF DATA AND COLLABORATION WITH PARTNERS TO IMPLEMENT AND EVALUATE EVIDENCE-BASED STRATEGIES IN THE AREAS OF ACES, TBI, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY AND SUICIDE.  THE ENHANCED PROPOSAL ACCOMPLISHES THIS GOAL THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION AND EVALUATION OF A TRAUMA-INFORMED WORKPLACE DESIGNATION ALONG WITH EXPANDED DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS OF OTHER INITIATIVES. OUTCOMESTENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (TDH) WILL UTILIZE DATA TO WORK WITH PARTNERS TO IMPLEMENT AND/OR EXPAND STRATEGIES WITH THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES FOR THE BASE COMPONENT:  INCREASE IN KNOWLEDGE OF PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR PARTICIPANTS IN HOME VISITING, INCREASE IN ORGANIZATIONS COMPLETING VIRTUAL ACES TRAINING, INCREASE IN EDUCATION PROVIDED TO CHILD SAFETY SEAT DISTRIBUTION PARTNER AGENCIES, INCREASE IN ORGANIZATIONS TRAINED TO IMPLEMENT VIRTUAL CHECKPOINTS GRADUATED DRIVERS? LICENSE PROGRAM, INCREASE IN ORGANIZATIONS MEETING SAFE STARS SAFETY CRITERIA, INCREASE IN HEALTHCARE AGENCIES IMPLEMENTING THE CDC MILD PEDIATRIC TBI GUIDELINES, IMPROVED RETURN TO LEARN/PLAY POLICIES THROUGH DISSEMINATION OF BEST PRACTICES AND AN INCREASE IN ORGANIZATIONS COMPLETING THE COUNSELING ON ACCESS TO LETHAL MEANS (CALM) TRAINING. TDH EXPECTS THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES FROM THE ENHANCED COMPONENT ACTIVITIES:  INCREASE IN ORGANIZATIONS DESIGNATED AS TRAUMA INFORMED, INCREASE IN EVALUATION FINDINGS OF THE VIRTUAL CHECKPOINTS PROGRAM, IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF HEALTHCARE AGENCIES UTILIZING THE CDC MILD TBI GUIDELINES, INCREASE IN EVALUATION OF RETURN TO LEARN/PLAY BEST PRACTICES AND INCREASE D COLLECTION OF QUALITATIVE DATA TO IMPROVE THE SAFE STARS SPORTS SAFETY DESIGNATION.

CORE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - CORE SIPP BASE COMPONENTTHE NEBRASKA INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (NIPP) IS WELL ESTABLISHED IN THE NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES AND INCLUDES OUTSTANDING SURVEILLANCE CAPACITY WHICH ENABLES THEM TO TARGET PREVENTION EFFORTS.  THE NIPP PROVIDES LEADERSHIP AND COORDINATION FOR A WIDE VARIETY OF PARTNERS FOR INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS ACROSS THE STATE.THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH KEY PARTNERS, THE NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (NIPP) WILL WORK TO ADDRESS THE PRIORITY AREAS OF ACES (ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES), TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TBI (TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY) BY REDUCING RISK FACTORS AND INCREASING PROTECTIVE FACTORS.  NIPP WILL IMPLEMENT THREE KEY STRATEGIES: ENGAGE IN ROBUST DATA/SURVEILLANCE FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION, STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION AND CONDUCT ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION. SHORT TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE:BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL BE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND UTILIZATION OF EMERGING DATA SOURCES FOR INJURY SURVEILLANCE AS EVIDENCED BY SHARING OF FINDINGS WITH STAKEHOLDERS AND DECISION MAKERS.BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL BE INCREASED ADOPTION OF SURVEILLANCE BEST PRACTICE BY NIPP AND AS EVIDENCED BY DATA INTEGRATION AND USE OF DATA SCIENCE.BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL BE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND UTILIZATION OF ROBUST DATA/SURVEILLANCE BEST PRACTICES BY NIPP AS EVIDENCED BY THE IDENTIFICATION OF DISPROPORTIONALLY AFFECTED POPULATIONS THROUGH DATA.BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL BE INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF INJURY AMONG POPULATIONS AT RISK AS EVIDENCED BY ENGAGEMENT OF STAKEHOLDERS INVOLVED IN PLANNING FOR WORK WITH DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED POPULATIONS.BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL BE INCREASED STAKEHOLDER INCLUSION IN PROGRAM PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, AND EVALUATION AS EVIDENCED BY AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER AND TYPE OF PARTNERS AS WELL AS THEIR ENGAGEMENT. BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL BE INCREASED INTEGRATION AMO NG MULTI-SECTORAL PARTNERS WITH SHARED COMMITMENT TO INJURY PREVENTION AS EVIDENCED BY AN INCREASE IN PARTNER INJURY PREVENTION ACTIVITIES.BY JULY 2022, RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TARGETED DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED COMMUNITIES WILL BE IDENTIFIED.BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL BE INCREASED IDENTIFICATION AND UNDERSTANDING OF APPROPRIATE EVIDENCE-INFORMED STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS IDENTIFIED NEEDS.BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL INCREASED ADOPTION AND UTILIZATION OF CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT ACTIVITIES.BY JULY 2022, THERE WILL BE INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF ONGOING EFFORTS AND GAPS IN JURISDICTION TO ADDRESS ACES, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TBI AS EVIDENCED BY AN INVENTORY OF CURRENT ACTIVITIES.MID-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE:BY JULY 2024, THERE WILL BE AN INCREASED ABILITY TO IDENTIFY AND RESPOND TO EMERGING INJURY THREATS WITHIN NEBRASKA.BY JULY 2024, THERE WILL BE AN INCREASED CAPACITY WITHIN NIPP AND THEIR PARTNERS TO STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES BY REDUCING RISK FACTORS AND INCREASING PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR INJURIES USING BEST AVAILABLE EVIDENCE.BY JULY 2024, THERE WILL BE SUSTAINED SUPPORT OF PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION SUPPORTED BY BEST AVAILABLE EVIDENCE AS DEMONSTRATED BY CONTINUED IMPLEMENTATION OF BEST PRACTICES BY NIPP AND PARTNERS.THE LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE:BY JULY 2026, REDUCE AND SUSTAIN INJURY MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY ASSOCIATED WITH ACES, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TBI IN NEBRASKA.BY JULY 2026, REDUCE AND SUSTAIN RISK FACTORS FOR ACES, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TBI IN NEBRASKA.BY JULY 2026, INCREASE AND SUSTAIN PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR ACES, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, AND TBI IN NEBRASKA.

INJURY PREVENTION AND CONTROL RESEARCH AND STATE AND COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAMS - THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH, THROUGH ITS OFFICE OF HEALTH PROMOTION, INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAM (IVPP), WILL IMPLEMENT THE ILLINOIS INJURY PREVENTION PROJECT (IIPP) TO SUPPORT THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE STATE STRATEGIC PLAN TO PREVENT INJURY, VIOLENCE, AND SUICIDE. THE PROJECT WILL ENHANCE THE IVPP CAPACITY TO ENGAGE IN ROBUST SURVEILLANCE AND STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION. ALL ACTIVITIES WILL BE GUIDED BY THE ILLINOIS PARTNERSHIP FOR SAFETY (IPS) WITH AN EMPHASIS ON THE FOLLOWING PRIORITY AREAS: ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES, TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY, AND TRANSPORTATION SAFETY.STRATEGIES INCLUDE:?ENGAGE IN ROBUST DATA/SURVEILLANCE FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IDENTIFY, COLLECT, AND DISSEMINATE DATA ON THE PRIORITY AREAS. EXPAND THE NUMBER OF DATA SOURCES UTILIZED. EXPLORE NEW AVENUES TO SHARE THE DATA. IDENTIFY DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED POPULATIONS AND RISK FACTORS.  ?STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCT AN ENVIRONMENT SCAN OF PROGRAMS WORKING IN THE PRIORITY AREAS. EXPAND THE IPS MEMBERSHIP AND DEVELOP A PARTNERSHIP PLAN. BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH ENTITIES ADDRESSING THE PRIORITY AREAS. CONDUCT STRATEGIC CONVERSATIONS WITH COMMUNITIES TO INCREASE THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF THE DATA, GAIN THEIR INPUT, AND ASSIST THEM IN APPLYING THE DATA TO INFORM THEIR EFFORTS. ?CONDUCT ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ASSESS THE DATA AND UTILIZE THE PARTNERSHIPS TO IDENTIFY UNIQUE RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS THAT IMPACT DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED POPULATIONS.

KANSAS CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - THE KANSAS CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM WILL STRENGTHEN THE STATE?S INJURY PREVENTION DATA, PROGRAMS AND POLICIES, AND PARTNERSHIPS AS WELL AS DEMONSTRATE IMPACT IN THE REDUCTION OF RISK FACTORS AND INCREASE IN PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI), AND SUICIDE. FOCUS WILL BE ON DISPROPORTIONATELY-AFFECTED COMMUNITIES AND POPULATIONS WITHIN KANSAS.THREE OVERARCHING STRATEGIES WILL GUIDE THE KANSAS CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM: 1) ENGAGE IN ROBUST DATA/SURVEILLANCE FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION; 2) STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION; AND 3) CONDUCT ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION. CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT AND COMMITMENT TO HEALTH EQUITY AND SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH WILL INFLUENCE AND REINFORCE THE STRATEGIES AS WILL CONCENTRATION ON CONTEXTUAL AND CROSS-CUTTING THEMES OF STRENGTHENING ECONOMIC SUPPORTS, SOCIAL NORMS, AND CONNECTEDNESS. KEY PARTNERS, PROGRAMS, AND POLICIES WILL LEAD AND STRENGTHEN EFFORTS IN THE TOPICAL AREAS OF FOCUS WHICH INCLUDE PREVENTION OF ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY (TBI), AND SUICIDE.

MISSISSIPPI CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM - THE MISSISSIPPI STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (MSDH), BUREAU OF INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROPOSES THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE MISSISSIPPI CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (MS CORE SIPP). IN MISSISSIPPI, UNINTENTIONAL INJURIES ARE THE LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH AMONG POPULATIONS AGED 5 TO 44 YEARS, WITH SIGNIFICANT RACIAL AND GEOGRAPHIC DISPARITIES STATEWIDE. THE PURPOSE OF THE MS CORE SIPP IS TO STRENGTHEN INFRASTRUCTURE, ENGAGE IN ROBUST STATE-BASED DATA AND SURVEILLANCE, STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS, AND CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS AND EVALUATION TO IDENTIFY AND RESPOND TO EXISTING AND EMERGING INJURY THREATS WITH DATA-DRIVEN PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONS.  THESE ACTIONS ARE INTENDED TO INCREASE PROTECTIVE FACTORS AND REDUCE RISK FACTORS USING THE BEST AVAILABLE EVIDENCE FOR INJURIES.  THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS APPROACH IS TO INFORM PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION FOR INJURY PREVENTION OF ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES) ? MAINLY HOUSEHOLD DYSFUNCTION; TRANSPORTATION SAFETY ? ALCOHOL-IMPAIRED AND DISTRACTED DRIVING, SEATBELT USE; TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY ? PLAYGROUND AND SPORTS-RELATED SAFETY, MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENTS AND FALLS; AND SUICIDE ? FIREARM SAFETY AND STORAGE (LOCAL TOPIC OF CONCERN).  THESE FOUR PRIORITIES ARE LINKED BY A CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT APPROACH AND A SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH LENS.  VIEWING UNINTENTIONAL INJURIES NOT AS A PROBLEM THAT NEEDS CONTROL, BUT IN A COMMUNITY AND SOCIAL CONTEXT, OR NEIGHBORHOOD AND BUILT ENVIRONMENT INCREASES SUSTAINABILITY, AND ALLOWS THE STATE TO BETTER DEMONSTRATE IMPACT ON INJURY OUTCOMES. THE MS CORE SIPP SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE 1) AN INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND UTILIZATION OF EMERGING DATA SOURCES FOR INJURY SURVEILLANCE; 2) INCREASED ADOPTION OF SURVEILLANCE BEST PRACTICES; 3) INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND UTILIZATION OF ROBUST DATA/SURVEILLANCE BEST PRACTICES; 4) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF INJURY AMONG DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED POPULATIONS; 5) INCREASED STAKEHOLDER INCLUSION IN PROGRAM P LANNING, IMPLEMENTATION AND EVALUATION; 6) INCREASED INTEGRATION AMONG MULTI-SECTORAL AND CROSS CUTTING PARTNERS WITH SHARED COMMITMENT TO INJURY PREVENTION; 7) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR IDENTIFIED DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED COMMUNITIES; 8) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF APPROPRIATE EVIDENCE-INFORMED STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS IDENTIFIED NEEDS; 9) INCREASED ADOPTION OF CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PRACTICES; AND 10) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF ONGOING EFFORTS AND GAPS STATEWIDE TO ADDRESS NOFO PRIORITY AREAS. USING EVIDENCE-BASED STRATEGIES, THE MS CORE SIPP WILL IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE EMERGING DATA SOURCES, TRANSLATE, AND DISSEMINATE SURVEILLANCE PRODUCTS FOR TOPICS OF INTEREST AND DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED POPULATIONS TO COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS AND OTHER KEY PARTNERS TO DRIVE PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION.  THE MS CORE SIPP WILL BE GUIDED BY AN INJURY PREVENTION WORKGROUP, FOCUSED ON THE IDENTIFICATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF STATEWIDE INJURY PREVENTION STRATEGIES.  STRATEGIC COLLABORATIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS WILL INCLUDE NATIONAL CENTER FOR INJURY PREVENTION AND CONTROL (NCIPC)-FUNDED PROGRAMS, GROUPS THAT ARE CROSS CUTTING AND MULTI-SECTORAL IN NATURE, AND NON-TRADITIONAL PARTNERS, WITH A FOCUS ON POPULATIONS THAT ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY ACES, TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY, AND SUICIDE.

WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (CORE SIPP) - WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (DOH) PROPOSES A COMPREHENSIVE PROJECT TO ADDRESS INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION THROUGH THE LENS OF SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES. WHILE WE HAVE MADE SUBSTANTIAL PROGRESS, INJURIES CONTINUE TO BE THE LEADING KILLER OF CHILDREN AND ADULTS AGED 1? 44 IN THIS STATE AND THE UNITED STATES. IN TOTAL, 5,195 WASHINGTON RESIDENTS DIED FROM INJURIES AND VIOLENCE IN 2019. DOH AND IVP HAVE A LONG HISTORY OF PREVENTION WORK AND HAVE BUILT DATA-DRIVEN, EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS TO PREVENT INJURIES AND VIOLENCE FROM OCCURRING IN THE FIRST PLACE. WE REQUEST $250,000 FOR THE FIRST YEAR OF THIS FIVE-YEAR PROJECT TO MAXIMIZE AND SUSTAIN IMPACT IN THE THREE PRIORITY FOCUS AREAS: TRANSPORTATION SAFETY, TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY, AND ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES). IN ADDITION, WE REQUEST AN ADDITIONAL $150,000 FOR THE FIRST YEAR IN IMPLEMENTATION AND ENHANCED EVALUATION FUNDING TO DEVELOP AND CONDUCT AN EVALUATION OF WASHINGTON?S TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAMS. DOH WILL PARTNER WITH EXISTING LEADERS IN EACH OF THE FOCUS AREAS TO ADVANCE THE COLLABORATIVE PREVENTION OF INJURY AND MAXIMALLY LEVERAGE RESOURCES, AND WE WILL CONTINUE TO USE DATA AND EMERGING RESEARCH TO UNDERSTAND SPECIFIC ISSUES FACING THE DIVERSE POPULATION OF WASHINGTON STATE WHILE MONITORING FOR EMERGING INJURY TRENDS. OUR ONGOING COMMITMENT TO EXPLORING SHARED RISK AND PROTECTIVE FACTORS IMPACTING CORE STATE INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM (SIPP) FOCUS AREAS AND OTHER IVP TOPICS WILL STRENGTHEN OUR UPSTREAM PREVENTION EFFORTS AND A CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT APPROACH WILL ENSURE THAT WE DELIVER STRONG PROGRAMS THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY INJURY AND VIOLENCE. SIPP FUNDS WILL ALLOW US TO BUILD UPON PREVIOUS WORK, STRENGTHENING OVERALL IVP INFRASTRUCTURE IN THE AREAS OF DATA COLLECTION AND DISSEMINATION, PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATION, AND EVALUATION AND ASSESSMENT. OUR WORK O VER THE NEXT FIVE YEARS WILL BE CRITICAL TO SUPPORTING WASHINGTON?S MOST VULNERABLE RESIDENTS, IMPROVING THEIR HEALTH AND THE HEALTH OF OUR STATE.

PUERTO RICO VIOLENT DEATHS REPORTING SYSTEM (PRVDRS) - NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NVDRS) CDC-RFA-CE21-2105PUERTO RICO PROPOSALABSTRACTTHE PUERTO RICO INSTITUTE OF STATISTICS (PRIS) IS PUERTO RICO?S GOVERNMENT INSTITUTION THATADMINISTERS AND SUPPORTS THE PUERTO RICO VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (PRVDRS) SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN SEPTEMBER OF 2016. THE PRVDRS STAFF HAS ESTABLISHED THE PROTOCOLS AND PROCEDURES TO COLLECT NVDRS STANDARD DATA ELEMENTS ON ALL VIOLENT DEATHS IN PUERTO RICO AND SUBMITS THIS INFORMATION IN DE-IDENTIFIED FORM TO CDC USING A WEB-BASED DATA ENTRY SYSTEM. DATA ELEMENTS ARE COLLECTED FROM THREE SOURCES: DEATH CERTIFICATES, CORONER/MEDICAL EXAMINER REPORTS INCLUDING TOXICOLOGY REPORTS, AND LAW ENFORCEMENT REPORTS.ONE OF THE MAIN REASONS FOR IMPLEMENTING AN EPIDEMIOLOGICAL SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM OF VIOLENT DEATHS IN PUERTO RICO IS THE HIGH RATES OF HOMICIDES, PARTICULARLY AMONG YOUNG MALES AND THE USE OF FIREARMS AS THE MAIN MECHANISM OF FATAL INJURY; APPROXIMATELY 9 OUT OF 10 HOMICIDES AMONG MALES OCCUR USING A FIREARM.THIS APPLICATION PROPOSES TO CONTINUE WITH THE STATE WIDE VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM AS RECOMMENDED BY THE CDC?S NVDRS PROGRAM UNDER RFA?S OPTION 1. THE LONG TERM OBJECTIVE IS TO HAVE A SUSTAINABLE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM FOR ALL VIOLENT DEATHS INCIDENTS INCLUDING HOMICIDES, SUICIDES, AND UNINTENTIONAL VIOLENT DEATHS. THE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM IS OPERATIONAL SINCE 2016 AND IN SUBSEQUENT YEARS ADDITIONAL IMPROVEMENTS HAVE BEEN MADE TO THE SYSTEM IN ORDER TO ADDRESS PROJECT CHALLENGES AND ENHANCE PROJECT PERFORMANCE INCLUDING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF ELECTRONIC DATA COLLECTION FROM THE PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH VITAL STATISTICS OFFICE AND THE PUERTO RICO POLICE BUREAU?S (PRPB) MONTHLY HOMICIDE BRIEF REPORT, AND IMPROVE FIREARMS DATA QUALITY AND COMPLETENESS.THE INSTITUTE OF FORENSIC SCIENCES (IFS) IS THE SOLE INSTITUTION THAT CARRIES OUT FORENSIC INVESTIGATIONS INCLUDING MEDICAL-LEGAL, TOXICOLOGY, AND CRIMINAL LABORATORY ANALYSIS THROUGHOUT ALL OF PUERTO RI CO AND IS CENTRALIZED IN THEIR MAIN OFFICE IN SAN JUAN. SIMILARLY, THE PRPB IS THE PRINCIPAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY IN CHARGE OF INVESTIGATIONS INVOLVING ALL VIOLENT DEATHS. FINALLY, DEATH CERTIFICATES ARE REGISTERED AT PUERTO RICO?S DEMOGRAPHIC REGISTER WHICH IS A COMPONENT UNIT OF THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (DOH).THE OVERARCHING GOAL IS TO MAINTAIN THE QUALITY OF WORK SUCH THAT PRVDRS CONTINUE TO MEET NVDRS DATA QUALITY STANDARDS AND CRITERIA FOR PUBLICATION IN NVDRS REPORTS. THE PROPOSED OBJECTIVES AND ACTIVITIES AIM FOR THE OPTIMIZATION OF THE TIMELINESS AND COMPLETENESS IN CASE FINDING, CASE REPORTING AS WELL AS QUALITY OF DATA OBTAINED FROM THE THREE KEY SOURCES OF INFORMATION: IFS, PRPB AND DOH. THE PRVDRS HAS ESTABLISHED AND RENEWED THE MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING WITH THESE INSTITUTIONS.IN THE FIVE YEARS OF ESTABLISHING THE PRVDRS, PROCEDURES AND PROTOCOLS HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED TO DOCUMENT ALL REPORTED VIOLENT DEATHS INCIDENTS IN THE ISLAND BY CONSOLIDATING THE INFORMATION FROM THE THREE MAIN SOURCES OF INFORMATION. THE PRVDRS WORK-PLAN FOCUSES ON THE TWO MAIN OUTCOMES OF THE NVDRS PROGRAM: 1. CONTINUE WITH THE STRONG WORKING RELATIONSHIP DEVELOPED OVER THE LAST FIVE YEARS WITH THE THREE KEY PARTNERS RESPONSIBLE FOR DOCUMENTING VIOLENT DEATHS IN PUERTO RICO; 2. DISSEMINATE DATA AND REPORTS TO KEY PARTNERS AND OTHER KEY STAKEHOLDERS (E.G. COUNTY GOVERNMENTS, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, UNIVERSITIES, NON-GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS, ETC.).

TO INCREASE WEST VIRGINIA'S CAPACITY FOR VIOLENT DEATH PREVENTION AND INTERVENTION BY COLLECTING,ANALYZING AND EVALUATING SURVEILLANCE DATA GATHERED IN THE NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM. - INJURY AND VIOLENCE RELATED DEATHS ARE A SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH CONCERN IN THE UNITED STATES AND ARE AMONG THE LEADING CAUSES OF DEATH FOR INDIVIDUALS AGED 1-39 YEARS. OUT OF THE ROUGHLY 59,000 TOTAL VIOLENT DEATHS IN THE UNITED STATES, WEST VIRGINIA (WV) ACCOUNTS FOR, ON AVERAGE, 500 OF THOSE DEATHS. THE PURPOSE FOR APPLYING FOR THIS GRANT IS TO INCREASE WEST VIRGINIA?S CAPACITY FOR VIOLENT DEATH PREVENTION AND INTERVENTION BY COLLECTING, ANALYZING AND EVALUATING SURVEILLANCE DE-IDENTIFIED DATA GATHERED THROUGH THE NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM. BY PARTICIPATING IN THIS SURVEILLANCE PROGRAM WE WILL BE ABLE TO MORE ACCURATELY IDENTIFY THE FACTS SURROUNDING VIOLENT DEATHS AND TARGET INTERVENTION AND PREVENTION PROGRAMS BASED UPON THOSE FACTS. RESEARCH HAS SHOWN THE OVERALL ENVIRONMENT PLAYS AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN DETERMINING PRECURSORS TO VIOLENCE, SUCH AS MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE.   GATHERING DATA FROM KEY PARTNERS SUCH AS WV HEALTH STATISTICS CENTER (VITAL STATISTICS), MEDICAL EXAMINER?S OFFICE, AND LAW ENFORCEMENT IS COMMON PRACTICE AT THE WEST VIRGINIA OFFICE OF THE CHIEF MEDICAL EXAMINER (OCME). THE OCME WILL CONTINUE TO ENHANCE COLLABORATION WITH THESE PARTNERS, THE VIOLENT DEATH ADVISORY GROUP, WEST VIRGINIA VIOLENCE AND INJURY PREVENTION PROGRAM, AND OTHER STATEWIDE ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE INTEREST IN PREVENTING VIOLENT DEATHS, TO ENSURE TIMELY AND ACCURATE DATA COLLECTION AND DISSEMINATION. BECAUSE ALL CASES OF VIOLENT DEATH FALL UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF THE OCME, IT ALLOWS FOR A CENTRAL SOURCE OF DATA COLLECTION. THE ABILITY TO UTILIZE THE NVDRS WEB-BASED DATA ENTRY SYSTEM WILL BE VITAL IN INCREASING THE TARGETING OF VIOLENT DEATH PREVENTION AND INTERVENTION EFFORTS IN WV.

NEBRASKA VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM - VIOLENCE IS A MAJOR PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM IN NEBRASKA AS WELL AS IN THE UNITED STATES. VIOLENT DEATHS COSTS OVER $409 MILLION IN MEDICAL CARE AND LOST PRODUCTIVITY, AND SUICIDE IS A TOP TEN LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH IN NEBRASKA. FURTHER, AGE-ADJUSTED SUICIDE AND HOMICIDES RATES ARE INCREASING OVER THE LAST SEVERAL YEARS IN NEBRASKA. VIOLENCE IS PREVENTABLE. HOWEVER, MEANINGFUL PREVENTION STARTS WITH KNOWING THE CONTRIBUTING CIRCUMSTANCES TO THESE VIOLENT DEATHS. A ROBUST, HIGH-QUALITY DATASET THAT PROVIDES A CLEARER PICTURE OF THE WHO, WHAT, WHERE, WHEN, WHY, AND HOW AN INDIVIDUAL DIED WILL INFORM VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS. INFORMED VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS BASED ON THIS DATA WILL CREATE OPPORTUNITY FOR IMPACTFUL VIOLENCE PREVENTION WORK. ULTIMATELY, THESE EFFORTS WILL STRIVE TO ELIMINATE VIOLENT DEATH IN NEBRASKA.THE NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (NDHHS) IS SUBMITTING A GRANT APPLICATION UNDER THE ?COLLECTING VIOLENT DEATH INFORMATION USING THE NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NVDRS)? FUNDING OPPORTUNITY ANNOUNCEMENT. THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW NDHHS TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS REGARDING DATA COLLECTION AND DISSEMINATION OF ACCURATE, TIMELY, AND COMPREHENSIVE SURVEILLANCE DATA ON ALL VIOLENT DEATH IN NEBRASKA USING CDC GUIDELINES AND THE CDC WEB-BASED DATA ENTRY SYSTEM. THE COLLECTION AND DISSEMINATION OF COMPREHENSIVE VIOLENT DEATH INFORMATION WILL RAISE AWARENESS, PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR COLLABORATION AND GUIDE VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS IN OUR STATE AND ULTIMATELY REDUCE DEATHS VIOLENT DEATHS.NEBRASKA WILL FOCUS ON TWO KEY OUTCOMES TO ACCOMPLISH THE AFOREMENTIONED PROJECT PURPOSE. FIRST, NEBRASKA WILL IMPROVE AND STRENGTHEN RELATIONSHIPS WITH KEY PARTNERS. THE NEBRASKA VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NEVDRS) HAS A STRONG HISTORY OF DATA PROVIDER PARTICIPATION AND WILL CONTINUE TO FUND A PART-TIME POSITION DEVOTED TO CONTINUING TO BUILD THESE CRITICAL RELATIONSHIPS. BY THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, THE GOAL FOR NEVDRS I S 100% PARTICIPATION FROM DATA PROVIDERS. DATA PROVIDER SUPPORT FOR NEVDRS WILL BE BOLSTERED BY ONGOING INNOVATIVE EFFORTS TO ENGAGE WITH AND SUPPORT DATA PROVIDER PARTNERS. SECOND, NEBRASKA WILL DISSEMINATE REPORTS, DATA BRIEFS, FACTSHEETS, PRESENTATIONS, PUBLICATIONS, POLICY BRIEFS, WEBINARS, BROCHURES, ETC. TO SUPPORT VIOLENCE PREVENTION. NEVDRS WILL WORK TO INCREASE THE OUTPUT NUMBER OF THESE REPORTS AND CONTINUE TO EXPAND EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS WITH VIOLENCE PREVENTION AGENCIES. NEVDRS DATA WILL BE USED IN ONGOING VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS IN NEBRASKA.

COLLECTING VIOLENT DEATH INFORMATION USING THE NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM - THE PURPOSE OF THE DELAWARE VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (DVDRS) IS TO COLLECT INFORMATION ABOUT VIOLENT DEATHS IN DELAWARE AND WITH THIS COMPREHENSIVE INFORMATION, GUIDE STATE AND LOCAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAMS AND POLICY. THE TARGET FOR THE DVDRS IS TO BUILD STRONG PARTNERSHIPS TO COLLECT THE NECESSARY DATA AND DISSEMINATE FOR EFFECTIVE USE.  THE DVDRS FOLLOWS THE GUIDELINES OF THE NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NVDRS) AND DELAWARE'S DATA ARE INTEGRATED WITHIN THE NVDRS. KEY PARTNERSHIPS HAVE BEEN FORGED TO COLLECT AND ABSTRACT THE NECESSARY DATA FROM KEY PROVIDERS IN THE STATE. DVDRS WILL CONTINUE TO FOLLOW THE ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN THE WORK PLAN.  THE DVDRS PROVIDES VALUABLE AND ACCURATE INFORMATION ON THE PATTERNS OF VIOLENCE AND CIRCUMSTANCES SURROUNDING VIOLENT DEATHS. THIS INFORMATION CAN BE USED TO IMPROVE POLICY AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AS WELL AS TO EVALUATE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF POLICIES AND PROGRAMS.  THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME FOR THE DVDRS IS TO REDUCE VIOLENCE MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY IN THE STATE.

MISSOURI COLLECTING VIOLENT DEATH INFORMATION USING NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NVDRS) - A WELL-RECOGNIZED AND SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUE IN THE UNITED STATES (U.S.), VIOLENCE AFFECTSPEOPLE OF ALL GENDERS, AGES, RACES, ETHNICITIES, RELIGIONS AND SEXUAL ORIENTATIONS. WITH A POPULATIONOF JUST OVER SIX MILLION, MISSOURI RECORDED 1,931 VIOLENT DEATHS (HOMICIDES, SUICIDES ANDUNDETERMINED DEATHS) IN 2019 ? THE 10TH HIGHEST RATE OF VIOLENT DEATH IN THE UNITED STATES. THEMAGNITUDE OF VIOLENT DEATH IN MISSOURI IS UNDERSCORED BY THE FACT THAT MISSOURI HAS BOTH A RATE OFSUICIDE THAT IS STATISTICALLY SIGNIFICANTLY HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL RATE (18.2 PER 100,000 COMPAREDTO 13.9 PER 100,000 IN 2019) AND TWO CITIES THAT RANKED AS HAVING THE 2ND AND 6TH HIGHEST RATES OFVIOLENT CRIME IN U.S. CITIES WITH POPULATIONS OVER 250,000. SUICIDE RATES HAVE INCREASED FROM14.0 TO 18.1 PER 100,000 BETWEEN 2010 AND 2019. VIOLENT DEATHS IN BOTH CITIES CONTINUE TO BE ANENDEMIC PROBLEM DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTING MINORITY COMMUNITIES AND ARE THE SOURCE OFSIGNIFICANT PAIN AND SUFFERING TO THE SURVIVING FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES. THE MISSOURI VIOLENTDEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (MOVDRS) WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2017 THROUGH A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTBETWEEN THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND SENIOR SERVICES (MO DHSS) AND THE U.S. CENTERSFOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) IN AN EFFORT TO ADDRESS THE SIGNIFICANT, PREVENTABLE PUBLICHEALTH ISSUE OF VIOLENCE.THE MOVDRS COLLECTS VIOLENT DEATH DATA FROM DEATH CERTIFICATES, CORONERS, MEDICAL EXAMINERS,AND LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES TO GATHER HIGH QUALITY, COMPREHENSIVE DATA ON THE CIRCUMSTANCESSURROUNDING VIOLENT DEATHS. EACH YEAR, MOVDRS LEVERAGES FUNDING AND PARTNERSHIPS TO:? COLLECT HIGH QUALITY, COMPREHENSIVE VIOLENT DEATH;? IMPROVE DATA QUALITY AND TIMELINESS;? EXPAND DATA COLLECTION AND STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS WITH EXISTING DATA PROVIDERS;? DISSEMINATE MOVDRS DATA FOR USE BY VIOLENCE PREVENTION PARTNERS;? INVESTIGATE AND IMPLEMENT INNOVATIVE METHODS OF IMPROVING AND USING MOVDRS DATA;? WORK WITH STAKEHOLDERS AND PARTNERS TO INCORPORATE FEEDBACK INTO THE MOVDRSIMPLEMENTATION FOR CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT.THE MOVDRS PROGRAM DISSEMINATES DATA FOR USE BY THE STATE AND LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENTS,COMMUNITY HEALTH PROGRAM PLANNERS, HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS, STUDENTS, RESEARCHERS ANDEPIDEMIOLOGISTS TO DEVELOP RESEARCH AND GUIDE DECISIONS ON VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS IN THEIRRESPECTIVE COMMUNITIES. THESE DATA ARE REGULARLY EVALUATED TO REPORT TIMELY VIOLENCE-RELATEDSTATISTICS FOR THE PUBLIC, IDENTIFY RISK FACTORS, AND INFORM AND EVALUATE PREVENTION PROGRAMS,LEGISLATION, AND HEALTH POLICIES. AS A STANDARDIZED SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM, MISSOURI WILL BE ABLE TOCOMPARE VIOLENT DEATH DATA NATIONALLY AND WITH STATES THAT SHARE SIMILAR DEMOGRAPHICS.MOVDRS STAFF CONTINUALLY WORK WITH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERS ON INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TOINCREASING DATA QUALITY AND COMPLETENESS AND INTEGRATING DATA TO CREATE A MORE COMPREHENSIVEUNDERSTANDING OF VIOLENT DEATH.IN SUMMARY, THIS FUNDING WILL ENABLE MISSOURI TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE THE MOVDRSFACILITATING MISSOURI?S CAPACITY TO GATHER DATA ON VIOLENT DEATHS BEYOND CONVENTIONAL MEANS.FURTHERMORE, DATA DISSEMINATION FROM THIS SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO BE USED TO ACTIVELY ENGAGEPARTNERS TOWARDS IMPLEMENTING EVIDENCE-BASED VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAMS IN THEIR RESPECTIVECOMMUNITIES TO REDUCE VIOLENT DEATHS. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE NVDRS PROGRAM IS TO GENERATETIMELY, QUALITY DATA THAT MEETS THE NEEDS OF PUBLIC HEALTH IN MISSOURI.

LOUISIANA VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM - PROJECT ABSTRACT: THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (LDH) OFFICE OF PUBLIC HEALTH (OPH) BUREAU OF FAMILY HEALTH (BFH) IS THE SINGULAR, QUALIFIED DEPARTMENT WITHIN OPH CONCENTRATING ON INJURY AND VIOLENCE REDUCTION STRATEGIES. FOR THE LAST 20 YEARS, BFH HAS MANAGED FETAL, INFANT, CHILD, AND MATERNAL MORTALITY AND INJURY SURVEILLANCE, THE PAST FIVE OF WHICH HAS INCLUDED THE NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NVDRS) PROGRAM. VIOLENT DEATH IS AN EPIDEMIC IN LOUISIANA. FROM 2015-2019, ALMOST 6700 INDIVIDUALS IN LOUISIANA LOST THEIR LIVES AS A RESULT OF VIOLENCE. THESE PERSONS LEFT BEHIND FAMILY AND FRIENDS WHOSE LIVES WERE MOST LIKELY FOREVER AFFECTED BOTH EMOTIONALLY AND FINANCIALLY.    PARTICIPATION IN THE NVDRS HAS PROVIDED LOUISIANA WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO BUILD ON PAST INJURY AND MORTALITY WORK, FURTHER STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS, AND CAPITALIZE ON THE HIGH LEVEL OF STATE ATTENTION ON IMPROVING LOUISIANA?S ABILITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE IMPACT OF VIOLENCE ON OUR COMMUNITIES. WITH THIS PROPOSAL, THE OPH BFH SEEKS TO CONTINUE TO LEAD THE STATE?S MORTALITY AND INJURY SURVEILLANCE EFFORTS AND SUPPORT THE DATA NEEDS OF COLLABORATING PREVENTION PARTNERS THROUGH NVDRS OPTION 1.   OVER THE PAST FIVE YEARS, THE LOUISIANA VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (LA-VDRS) HAS EXPANDED FROM A PILOT PROGRAM OF FOUR PARISHES (COUNTIES) IN 2017 TO A STATEWIDE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM COLLECTING DATA ON VIOLENT DEATHS ACROSS LOUISIANA SINCE 2018. LA-VDRS HAS WORKED TO BUILD PARTNERSHIPS AND HAS INCREASED DATA COLLECTION CAPABILITIES. AS OF SPRING OF 2021, THERE ARE 52 CORONERS, 53 SHERIFF?S OFFICES, AND 39 POLICE DEPARTMENTS PROVIDING CASE INFORMATION TO LA-VDRS. THESE PARTNERSHIPS WITH CORONER OFFICES AND LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES HAVE IMPROVED DATA QUALITY AND TIMELINESS OF LA-VDRS DATA, AND WILL ALLOW LOCAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION PARTNERS TO USE CIRCUMSTANTIAL VIOLENT DEATH INFORMATION TO CREATE INTERVENTIONS AND POLICY CHANGES TO DECREASE VIOLENT DEATHS ACROSS THE STATE.  OTHER ACCOMPLISHMENTS THE LA-VDRS PROGRAM HAS MADE OVER THE PAST FIVE YEARS ARE CREATING A FULLY ELECTRONIC MONTHLY IMPORT OF NVDRS AND SUDORS CASES INTO SAMS, CREATING INTERNAL TRACKING DOCUMENTS THAT HAVE INCREASED TIMELINESS, DATA QUALITY, AND HAS ALLOWED ABSTRACTORS TO FOCUS OUTREACH ACCORDINGLY, AND BEGAN PUBLISHING NVDRS DATA WITH LOCAL PARTNERS.   THE LA-VDRS TEAM PLANS TO USE ANOTHER YEAR OF NVDRS FUNDING TO CONTINUE TO BUILD UPON THESE PAST ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY PROVIDING CORONERS OFFICES WITH ACCESS TO MEDICOLEGAL DEATH INVESTIGATION SOFTWARE (MDILOG) TO CONTINUE TO IMPROVE DATA QUALITY AND TIMELINESS, MAKING DATA MORE READILY AVAILABLE TO PARTNERS THROUGH FINALIZING DATA USE AGREEMENTS FOR THE REQUEST OF CASE LEVEL LA-VDRS DATA, AND CREATING DATA BRIEFS AND REPORTS TO INFORM VIOLENCE PREVENTION STRATEGIES.    BFH?S EXPERIENCE AS THE STATE LEADER AND COLLABORATIVE PARTNER IN MORTALITY SURVEILLANCE, TRANSLATION OF DATA TO ACTION, MANAGEMENT OF MULTI-MILLION DOLLAR FEDERAL GRANTS, COMMITMENT OF LEADERSHIP TO IMPROVING INFORMATION SUPPORTING PUBLIC HEALTH EFFORTS, AND EXPERIENCE WITH THE PAST FIVE YEARS OF NVDRS FUNDING ARE THE SOLID FOUNDATION FOR CONTINUING TO RUN THE LA-VDRS PROGRAM. CONTINUED NVDRS FUNDING WILL ALLOW BFH TO BRING THE NECESSARY PARTNERS TO THE TABLE, COLLECT DATA ON A COMPLETE PICTURE OF THE CIRCUMSTANCES SURROUNDING VIOLENT DEATHS IN LOUISIANA, AND PROVIDE THE INFORMATION NECESSARY TO CREATE EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS AND POLICIES WHICH WILL, IN TURN REDUCE VIOLENT DEATH.

COLLECTING VIOLENT DEATH INFORMATION USING THE NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NVDRS) - CALIFORNIA IS A LARGE DIVERSE STATE WITH THE HIGHEST NUMBER OF VIOLENT DEATHS IN THE UNITED STATES. VIOLENCE-RELATED INJURIES, BOTH HOMICIDE AND SUICIDE, ARE A SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM THAT ADVERSELY AFFECTS THE HEALTH AND WELFARE OF ALL CALIFORNIANS. VIOLENCE IS NOT INEVITABLE AND CAN BE PREVENTED. ACCURATE AND TIMELY DATA IS A FIRST STEP TOWARD PREVENTION. THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH?S (CDPH) INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION BRANCH (IVPB) HAS A SUSTAINED COMMITMENT TO INJURY AND VIOLENCE SURVEILLANCE AND PREVENTION THAT POSITIONS IT WELL TO SUCCESSFULLY CONTINUE TO BE PART OF THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION?S (CDC) NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NVDRS). IVPB?S GOAL IS TO ADDRESS THE PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM OF VIOLENCE BY CONTINUING TO IMPLEMENT AN ACTIVE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM TO COLLECT AND DISSEMINATE ACCURATE, TIMELY, AND MORE COMPREHENSIVE DATA ON VIOLENT DEATHS IN CALIFORNIA USING CDC GUIDELINES AND WEB-BASED DATA ENTRY SYSTEM.  IVPB WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH STATE AND LOCAL PARTNERS AND CDC TO CARRY OUT THE REQUIRED PRIMARY ACTIVITIES: 1) USE OF CDC?S CASE DEFINITIONS; 2) CREATION OF A PLAN TO CONTINUE IMPLEMENTING NVDRS; 3) COLLECTION AND ABSTRACTION OF COMPREHENSIVE DATA ON VIOLENT DEATHS; 4) DISSEMINATION OF NVDRS DATA TO STAKEHOLDERS AND THE PUBLIC; AND 5) EXPLORATION OF INNOVATIVE METHODS TO COLLECT, ABSTRACT, AND USE NVDRS DATA FOR PREVENTION EFFORTS.  SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 1) INCREASED AND STRENGTHENED WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH KEY PARTNERS IN CALIFORNIA; AND 2) INCREASED DISSEMINATION OF DATA TO PARTNERS AND THE PUBLIC TO SUPPORT THEIR VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS. LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 1) INCREASED USE OF NVDRS DATA TO INFORM THE DESIGN, IMPLEMENTATION, AND EVALUATION OF VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAMS; 2) MORE EFFECTIVE PREVENTION EFFORTS; 3) REDUCED MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY DUE TO VIOLENCE IN CALIFORNIA; AND 4) INCREASED INNOVATIVE METHODS OF USING CALIFORNIA NVDRS DATA.   BY SUC CESSFULLY PRODUCING A CONTINUALLY IMPROVING VIOLENT DEATH SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM WITH HIGH QUALITY, COMPREHENSIVE, AND TIMELY DATA AND DISSEMINATION TO OUR PARTNERS, CALIFORNIA NVDRS DATA WILL ENHANCE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAMS AND POLICIES TO PREVENT AND REDUCE VIOLENT DEATHS AND NON-FATAL INJURIES BY INFORMING THE DESIGN, TARGETING, IMPLEMENTATION, AND EVALUATION OF THESE ACTIVITIES.

ALABAMA VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM PROGRAM - TO ESTABLISH THE NATIONAL VIOLENT DEATH REPORTING SYSTEM (NVDRS) IN ALABAMA THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH IS PARTNERING WITH THE ALABAMA CENTER FOR HEALTH STATISTICS, THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF FORENSICS, THE JEFFERSON COUNTY CORONER/MEDICAL EXAMINER?S OFFICE, THE ALABAMA CORONER?S ASSOCIATION, AND THE ALABAMA LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY TO COLLECT DATA ON VIOLENT DEATHS IN THE STATE. DATA WILL INCLUDE DEATH CERTIFICATES, AUTOPSY AND TOXICOLOGY REPORTS, MEDICAL EXAMINER AND CORONER REPORTS, AND POLICE REPORTS. THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION?S (CDC) WEB-BASED NVDRS WILL ALLOW FOR THE COLLECTION AND DISSEMINATION OF SURVEILLANCE DATA ON VIOLENT DEATHS WHICH IN TURN WILL PROVIDE A VIABLE OUTCOME OF IMPROVING THE PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, AND EVALUATION OF VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAMS. NVDRS WILL ALSO SERVE THE PURPOSE OF ALLOWING THE STATE TO ANALYZE THE CHARACTERISTICS AND TRENDS OF VIOLENT DEATHS WHICH NO OTHER ENTITY IN THE STATE IS CURRENTLY PERFORMING. THE PROGRAM WILL TARGET ALL VIOLENT DEATHS IN THE STATE?S 67 COUNTIES OCCURRING DURING 2022.  THE GOALS FOR NVDRS WILL INCLUDE CREATING AND MAINTAINING A CONTINUALLY IMPROVING SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM THAT COLLECTS HIGH QUALITY AND COMPREHENSIVE VIOLENT DEATH INFORMATION IN A TIMELY MANNER THAT COMPLIES WITH CDC GUIDELINES, AND DISSEMINATING NVDRS DATA TO PARTNERS AND THE PUBLIC TO SUPPORT VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND EXPLORE INNOVATIVE METHODS OF ACCESSING, REPORTING, AND SHARING DATA. STRATEGIES TO COMPLETE THESE GOALS WILL INCLUDE: CREATING A PLAN TO IMPLEMENT NVDRS, COLLECTING AND ABSTRACTING DATA REQUIRED BY NVDRS, ASSESSING THE CURRENT DEATH TOLL OF VIOLENCE WITHIN ALABAMA USING DEATH CERTIFICATE INFORMATION AND ADDITIONAL DATA UPLOADED TO NVDRS TO SHOW HOW ALABAMA RATES COMPARE TO NATIONAL RATES, GENERATING AN ANNUAL REPORT FOR THE STATE USING DE-IDENTIFIED NVDRS DATA, AND EXPLORING INNOVATIVE METHODS OF ACCESSING, REPORTING, AND SHARING DATA TO INCLUDE VIOLENCE PREVENTION ADVOC ACY GROUPS. THE SURVEILLANCE AND PREVENTION BRANCH ALREADY HAS THREE GREAT PRE-ESTABLISHED PARTNERSHIPS THAT WILL BENEFIT NVDRS. THOSE THREE PARTNERSHIPS ARE WITH THE ALABAMA CHILD DEATH REVIEW SYSTEM, THE SUICIDE AND PREVENTION PROGRAM, AND SUDORS. COLLABORATION WITH THESE THREE PROGRAMS WILL ASSIST IN EXPANDING THE USE OF NVDRS DATA.
